loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha tiene 31 años. Vive en compañía de su esposo Jhony, con quien tiene cuatro hijos, a los que cuida con mucho amor. Su casa es propia y se ubica en la localidad de Daniel Hernández.  
Durante las mañanas vende dulces en una escuela de su localidad con un triciclo en el patio de la institución. Ya tiene 2 años dedicándose a esta actividad y según cuenta le va muy bien, pues siempre vende un promedio de 70 nuevos soles, de los cuales tiene que sacar los gastos que invierte en la mercadería como también en el pago diario a la escuela por derechos de venta. Por otro lado, su esposo trabaja en una hacienda cortando pasto para los animales, ahí recibe un sueldo mensual. Pero los sábados y domingos él maneja la motocarro que ellos adquirieron hace algunos años, haciendo transporte de pasajeros, de ello obtienen un dinero extra para el hogar. Ahora necesitan arreglar su vehículo para seguir trabajando con normalidad.

Este es el primer crédito con MFP y agradece el apoyo brindado. Llegó a la su grupo por invitación de una de las socias más antiguas y está segura que con el apoyo financiero que reciba podrá incrementar sus ganancias, las que le servirán para adquirir mejoras en su negocio. Por esa razón promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Bertha invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de nuevos neumáticos para su motocarro y con el dinero restante comprará bebidas y dulces para su negocio.
texts.en:
Bertha is 31 years old. She lives with her husband Jhony and together they have four children, whom she cares for very lovingly. She owns her house, which is located in the town of Daniel Hernández.
In the mornings she sells candy in on of her town's schools. She uses a tricycle in the schoolyard of that institution. She's already been in this business for two years and, according to her, it's going very well, since she always sells an average of 70 nuevos soles. From that amount she needs to draw the expenses invested in merchandise as well as the daily payment to the school for the right to sell. In addition, her husband works in a farm cutting pasture for the animals, and he receives a monthly salary for that. However, on Saturdays and Sundays he drives the three-wheeler they purchased a few years ago and transports passengers, which gets them some extra money for the household. Now they need to repair their vehicle in order to keep working as usual.
This is her first loan with MFP and she gives thanks for the support she's gotten. She joined her communal bank by invitation from one of the older members. She's sure that the financial support she'll receive will allow her to increase her profits, which will be used to improve her business. For that reason she pledges to be punctual with her repayments.
Bertha will use the requested amount to purchase new tires for her three-wheeler, and with the rest of the money she will buy beverages and candy for her business.

loans.use: to purchase tires for her three-wheeler taxi and more candy and beverages for her stall.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La señora Marina tiene 29 años de edad vive en Pucarita Chica, un cantón al sud de la ciudad de Cochabamba, está casada con el Señor Julián, con quien tiene dos hijos pequeños, una niña de cinco años y un niño de cuatro años, ella se dedica a la producción de leche y su esposo a la construcción como albañil, son personas responsables y trabajadoras.
Marina cuenta que ella tuvo que dejar la escuela cuando su padre los abandonó a ella y a su madre. Junto con el hermano, la madre se dio a la bebida y Marina tenía que trabajar con las vacas y sacar adelante su familia, ella dice que su madre sufrió mucho por el abandono de sus padre pero que después de unos años se repuso, entonces fue cuando Mariana se fue a trabajar a Argentina junto con su tía. Ella cuenta que no fue fácil ya que tenía 14 años cuando se fue del país y le tocó trabajar de lo que pudo para salir adelante y poder ayudar a su madre con la educación de su hermano. Marina se conoció en Argentina con Julia, quien también se fue a trabajar allá para poder salir adelante ya que en nuestro país no hay fuentes de trabajo y ya como hace seis años atrás volvieron al país y se casaron y se construyeron su propia casa donde viven con sus hijos. Marina trata de ser la mejor madre y esposa ya que su madre no lo fue con ella y sus hermanos.
Marina ya tuvo un crédito anterior, el cual canceló sin problema este nuevo crédito es para la compra de semillas para sembrar alfa alfa para aumentar los insumos para su ganado y de esa manera tener una mejor producción.
texts.en:
Marina is 29 years old and lives in Pucarita Chica, a canton to the south of Cochabamba.  She is married to Julian, with whom she has two small children, a girl of five and a boy of four.  She works in the production of milk and her husband in construction as a bricklayer.  The are responsible, hardworking people.

Marina says that she had to leave school when her father abandoned her and her mother.  Together with her brother, her mother started drinking and Marina had to work with the cows and help her family get ahead.  She says that her mother suffered a lot because of the abandonment by her father but that she got better after a few years and that was when Marina went to live in Argentina with her aunt.  She says that it wasn't easy since she was only 14 when she left the country and she had to work to get ahead and to help her mother with the the aducation of her brother.

In Argentina Marina got to know Julian, who also went there to work in order to get ahead since in their country their aren't sources of work, but six years ago they returned to Bolivia and got married and they built their own house where they live with their children.

Marina tries to be a better mother and wife since  her mother wasn't very good with her and her siblings.  

Marina had a prior loan that she paid without problems.  This new loan is to buy seed to sow alfalfa to increase the feed for her livestock and in this way have better production.

loans.use: to buy alfalfa seed and feed for cows.

loans.name: Lina

texts.es: Lina es oriunda de un municipio donde fabrican calzado y por eso desde muy niña conoció muy bien estos procesos productivos, pues su familia los practicaba. Así fue como, una vez llegara  a la ciudad a estudiar en la Universidad, decidiera apoyar sus ingresos vendiendo lo que producían en su pueblo, en un principio tuvo devoluciones que se convirtieron en un gran desafío, pero poco a poco, fue conociendo a su clientela  y ha logrado superar esa situación y avanzar en su negocio. Su meta es duplicar sus  ventas pues su mayor merado se encuentra en los estudiantes de la universidad donde estudia y últimamente ha tenido que comprar a crédito y a precios no muy competitivos. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará calzado que tiene encargado y necesita hacerlo de contado para ganar descuentos y ofrecer un mejor precio a sus clientes, para continuar la fidelización de ellos.
texts.en: Lina comes from a shoemaking town. She became familiar with these manufacturing processes when she was very young, because her family was in this line of work. So once she came into the city to go to college, she decided to support herself by selling the products from her village. In the beginning she had refunds that became a big challenge, but gradually she got to know her clientele, and she succeeded in overcoming this situation and moving forward in her business. Her goal is to double her sales, because her biggest market is the students of the university where she studies. Lately she has had to buy on credit, at prices that are not so competitive. That's the reason why she requests a Kiva loan, her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to purchase shoes that are already ordered. She needs to pay by cash in order to get discounts and offer her customers a better price, so that she can continue to retain them.

loans.use: to purchase shoes.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace has been farming for 12 years in her rural home in Nyamira, where she stays with her husband and their two children. Her farm produces milk, tea, coffee and bananas, which she sells to the local market.

Grace has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to construct a modern dairy unit in her farm. She hopes to gain more income and expand her business as well as educate her children. Her future plan is to buy more parcels of land to expand her farming. Grace says that lack of developed local markets and occasional droughts remain her major challenges.

loans.use: To construct a modern dairy unit

loans.name: Elie

texts.en:
Elie is married and has six children aged between 7 and 22, all attending schools. He has been a maize farmer for 20 years and his wife is also a maize farmer. Elie would like to get this loan to buy more seeds, seed multiplication and support labor to get the best harvest. He want to use the profits to pay school fees for the children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for more seeds, seed multiplication and support labor

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr: Yao est un homme marié et père 2 enfants âgés respectivement de 6 et 8 ans.  Chauffeur de formation, il en exerce le métier. Malheureusement il ne peut plus exercer son activité parce que son véhicule est en panne. Il souhaite un crédit en vue d’acheter un nouveau moteur de marque TOYOTA. Il espère qu’avec ce crédit il pourra reprendre normalement ses activités et laisser libre court à ses rêves.
texts.en: Yao is married and the father of two children ages 6 and 8. He was trained as a driver, and that is his current job. Unfortunately he can't work any more because his vehicle is broken down. He would like to get a loan in order to buy a new Toyota engine. He hopes that the loan will allow him to work again and fulfill his dreams.

loans.use: to buy an engine for his vehicle.

loans.name: Isaul Antonio

texts.es:
Isaul sigue laborando como cadete de taxi, su hijo de 6 años, cursa la primaria, su esposa trabaja como cajera, ambos desean tener una casa con seguridad y digna para su hijo, aunque son muy sencillos económicamente esperan lograr el propósito.
Ya que se le ha hecho más fácil, ahora que están obteniendo crédito para mejorar su condición de vida al tener un casa segura. Con el crédito anterior era para comenzar a levantar de piedra el arranque, pero se le presento la dificultad de su letrina, en donde tuvo que hacer otro sumidero y cerrarla completamente, teniendo privacidad e higiene en su hogar. Es por eso con este nuevo préstamo comenzara a construir su cuarto. Materiales a comprar: bloques, arena, cemento, hierro y otros materiales.
texts.en:
Isaul continues to work as a taxi driver. His 6-year-old child is in primary school, and his wife works as a cashier. Both want to have a house that is safe and appropriate for their child, and although they are of very simple means economically, they hope to achieve their goal. 

This has become easier now that they are obtaining a loan to improve their living conditions and have a secure house. The previous loan was aimed at laying the blocks to build the structure, but the latrine became a problem, and he had to close it off completely and create another sewer connection in order to have privacy and hygiene in his home. Because of this, with this new loan he will start to build the room. The materials to be purchased are blocks, sand, cement, iron and other materials.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and build a room.

loans.name: Anastasie

texts.en:
Anastasie is married with four children aged between 4 and 13. All of the children attend schools. Her husband is also a maize farmer. She has been a maize farmer for 18 years. She would like to get this loan to buy more seeds, seed multiplication (production of seeds for sale or for future planting) and support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, she wants to make more savings.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more seeds, seed multiplication and support labor costs.

loans.name: Lili

texts.en:
Lili is 56 years old. She is a widow and lives alone in a small village in the Gurjaani District. Lili is busy with an agricultural business. In particular, she is busy with poultry farming.  She sells chickens, hens, cocks and eggs on the local open market.  She also has a plot of land. Lili’s total average monthly income is 650 Lari.

Lili requested a loan for cultivation of her agricultural land. After cultivation she plans to plant nuts there. She will work hard on her plot to receive a good harvest. Lili will sell the harvested products on the local open market and hopes to get an expected income. With increased income she will be able to repair the house. Taking into account the above mentioned, Lili will be able to spend her evenings after hard working days in a more comfortable environment.

loans.use: to cultivate land and plant nuts.

loans.name: Pedro Luis

texts.es: El señor Pedro Luis tiene 23 años de edad, vive en la Zona Sud de la ciudad de Cochabamba en la casa de sus padres y trabaja con su vehículo como radio taxi de una empresa local. Es estudiante en un instituto en la carrera de técnico en mecánica automotriz él se paga solo los estudios. Es por esa razón que trabaja todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche y después se va sus clases. Pedro tuvo que dejar el año pasado el transporte porque sus madre se enfermó. Luis y  su padre trabajaban en dos turnos por el día y la noche, él dice que gracias a Dios su madre salió adelante y ahora está trabajando como siempre. Él requiere el crédito para hacer arreglar el motor de su vehículo y de esa manera no tener problemas para poder terminar su carrera. En la gestión pasada se le otorgó el crédito para compra del gas de su vehículo. Luis es una persona responsable y siempre canceló sin problemas.
texts.en: Pedro Luis is 23 years old. He lives in his parents' house in the southern area of the town of Cochabamba. He uses his own vehicle to work as a radio taxi for a local company. He studies in an institute for a career as an auto mechanic technician, and he pays for his own studies. For that purpose he works everyday from 7 a.m. to 7 p.m., and then he goes to his classes. Pedro had to quit transportation last year, because his mother became ill. Luis and his father worked in shifts during the day and night, and he says that, thank God, his mother got better and now she's working as usual. He requests the loan in order to fix the engine in his vehicle so that he doesn't have any problems finishing his taxi rides. In the previous cycle he got a loan for purchasing gas for his vehicle. Luis is a responsible person and has always repaid without problems.

loans.use: to purchase spare engine parts and to pay for repair services.

loans.name: Isaac Misael

texts.es:
Isaac, hombre trabajador  cada día labora como cadete, para seguir con sus planes de construcción, junto a su esposa, siguen esforzándose ella continua laborando en servicios domésticos con el fin  de ir acondicionando su pequeña casa.
Hoy con este nuevo préstamo, repara el techo, techo que no es tan viejo pero se le pasa el agua, en donde lo quitara todo y comenzara hacer nueva la construcción del techo. Comprara láminas de zinc, cuartones, clavos, y comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Isaac is a hard working man. Every day he works as a driver in order to continue with his construction plans. Together with his wife they are continuing their efforts. She is still working as a housekeeper in order to get her small house set up. 

Today with this new loan Isaac will repair the roof. It's not that old, but it leaks water. He will take out everything where it leaks, and start with new construction of the roof. He will buy zinc sheeting, lumber, and nails and start the job.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheets, beams, and nails to improve the roof.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is 36 years old. She is married and lives in a small village in the Gurjaani district with her large family: her husband, Zaza, her two children (both attending the local school), her mother-in-law and her husband's aunt, both pensioners. Nino and Zaza earn their living through their agricultural business, in particular, livestock. They have pigs and sell piglets. They are very hardworking people and take good care of their livestock. The family owns a plot of land, where they grow peaches. Nino and Zaza are also busy selling goods. They buy agricultural products from local farmers and sell them on the local open market. The family's total average monthly income is 1,000 GEL.

Nino has requested a loan to purchase two pigs and more agricultural products for selling. She will diversify her assortment of fruits and vegetables and attract new customers, thus expanding her businesses. She will be able to sell more piglets and more products, which will increase the sales from her businesses. These expansions will increase the family's income accordingly. With increased income, Nino and Zaza will be able to repair their house and finance their children's studies.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and agricultural products for selling

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle transport for his business

loans.name: La Lumiere 1 Group

texts.en:
Gabriel, age 45, is married with 7 children, ages 7 to 30 years old. She has 4 children currently attending school. She also cares for her elderly father. Gabriel is representing the La Lumiere 1 group. She runs a small bakery where she makes beignets. She has been selling beignets in a local market in Brazzaville for 20 years! She will use the loan to buy flour, oil, sugar, corn, and firewood. Her business strategy is simple: to make good tasting beignets. She also sells them at a competitive price. 

Gabriel has received 1 previous loan from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo. She has a good repayment record. She hopes to use some of her business profits to enable her children to study abroad.

loans.use: to pay for flour, oil, sugar, corn, and firewood.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es: La Sra. Magdalena es un ejemplo de superación y perseverancia ya que ella junto con su esposo han podido sacar adelante a sus tres hijos luchando para que nada les falte, el es chofer de una línea de camiones de la ciudad y ella tiene un negocio de abarrotes. Magdalena sabe que con esta actividad ayuda  a su familia a salir adelante es por eso que en esta ocasión pide nuestra ayuda para la compra de mercancía ya que quiere hacer que su negocio crezca y de esta manera aportar más al gasto familiar y ofrecerles a sus hijos mejores oportunidades de superación al estudiar en escuelas de calidad.
texts.en: Magdalena is an example of overcoming obstacles and perseverance since she and her husband have been able to get their three children ahead.  They did this by fighting so that the family lacks nothing.  He is a city bus driver and she has her grocery business.  Magdalena knows that with this business she can help her family live better and that is why she is requesting our help.  She wants to buy merchandise since she would like her business to grow and carry more of the family expenses, and to offer her youngest children opportunities to get ahead and study in good quality schools.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is married with no children yet. His wife is also a maize farmer. He has been a maize farmer for 12 years. He would like to get this loan to buy more seeds, seed multiplication (production of seeds for sale or for future planting) and support labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, he wants to renovate his house and make savings.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more seeds, seed multiplication and support labor costs.

loans.name: Therese

texts.en:
Therese is married and has two children, ages 9 and 12. Her husband works as a farmer. She has been a maize farmer for ten years. 

She wants the loan to buy more seeds, for seed multiplication (production of seeds for sale or future planting), and for support labor to get the best harvest. She wants to use the profits to build a house and pay school fees for her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. 

For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for more seeds, seed multiplication, and labor costs.

loans.name: Jerome

texts.en:
Jerome is married with five children between the ages of 7 and 20. All of the children attend schools. He has been a maize farmer for 6 years and his wife is also a maize farmer. He would like to get this loan to buy more seeds, practice seed multiplication and support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he wants to renovate their house and pay school fees for the children. He is holding a Kiva profile form after filling it out.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more seeds, seed multiplication and support labor costs.

loans.name: Alejandro Nicanor

texts.es:
Alejandro es un hombre de 55 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, tiene 2 hijos quienes han sido su motivo y razón para seguir adelante y luchar para que ello sean hombres de bien, lastimosamente por diversas circunstancias desde hace varios años se separó de su pareja; Alejandro siempre ha sido una persona muy alegre, trabajadora y entusiasta; lamentablemente cuando era muy joven perdió a sus padres, desde entonces por la necesidad de trabajar y solventar sus gastos no pudo cursar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería Mecánica; en sus ratos libres le gusta dedicar un poco de tiempo al deporte y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pato par compartir con su familia.
Gracias a su espíritu emprendedor y a las buenas enseñanzas que le dejo su Padre, desde hace varios años Alejandro puso en marcha su pequeño taller de pintado de autos, él trabaja un aproximado de 11 horas diarias, en las cuales puede atender hasta 5 cliente; Alejandro se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que su negocio marcha bien debido a que sus clientes lo recomiendan por sus buenos trabajos y por su trato amable y respetuoso.
Alejandro se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de materiales de planchado, así también podrá renovar sus materiales de trabajo, tales como: pintura, pistola de pintar, lijas, thiner, barnices, entre otros; de esta manera Alejandro tendrá su negocio mejor acondicionado con materiales adecuados para realizar sus trabajos, así él podrá incrementar sus ventas e ingresos económicos, con los cuales desea poder dar los acabados que requiere su vivienda y así en un futuro no muy lejano espera poder tener otro taller de pintado de autos donde el pueda administrarlo.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 55 years old. He lives in the city of Pisco and has 2 children who have been his motivation and reason to press forward and struggle so that they become good men. Unfortunately for various reasons he separated from his wife some years ago. Alejandro has always been a very happy, hard-working and enthusiastic person. Sadly, when he was very young he lost his parents. Since then, due to the need of work and to afford his expenses he could not pursue a professional career, but he would have liked to study mechanical engineering. In his free time he likes to dedicate a little time to sports and on some occasions cook a delicious rice with duck to share with his family.

Thanks to his entrepreneurial spirit and good lessons from his father, Alejandro for some years has run his small garage painting cars. He works about 11 hours daily, during which he can attend to up to 5 customers. Alejandro is very happy doing his work and believes that his business is doing well due to his clients recommending him for his good work and for his kind and respectful treatment.

Alejandro is very grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the help provided he will be able to purchase welding and renovation materials such as: paint, paint gun, sand paper, paint thinner, varnishes among others. In this way, Alejandro would have his business better conditioned with adequate materials to do his jobs. In this way he will be able to increase his sales and economic income, with which he wants to be able to give his housing the finishes it requires and in the not too distant future he hopes to be able to have another shop for painting cars that he can manage.

loans.use: to buy materials welding and renovation materials such as: paint, paint gun, sand paper, paint thinner, varnishes, etc.

loans.name: Phocas

texts.en:
Phocas is married with six children. His wife is also a maize farmer. He has been a maize farmer for 15 years. He would like to get this loan to buy more seeds, seed multiplication (production of seeds for sale or for future planting) and support labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, he wants to build a house. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more seeds, seed multiplication and support labor costs.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is 34 years old and lives in the town of Tiribe in the Kenyan coastal region of Kenya. She is married and has four children, all of whom are currently in school. For the past two years, Kwekwe has been working hard to manage her small business of selling omena (small dried fish). 

To help expand her business, she has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings from Yehu. The loan will be used to buy more dried fish for resale, and will help Kwekwe to generate greater profits and improve her business. She hopes that in the future she will be able to increase the success of her business.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish for resale.

loans.name: Eter

texts.en:
Eter is a 66-year-old widow. She lives alone in a small village of the Gurjaani district. Eter is busy with farming. She has a vineyard and a plot of land where maize is grown. She is especially busy in the spring and summer seasons in order to get a good harvest. She sells harvested grapes and maize on the local open market. Eter’s total average monthly income is 300 Lari. She works hard, but her income is hardly enough for food and for everyday expenses. She cannot make savings for purchasing additional needed household goods or renovation of the house.

Eter requested a loan for cultivation and fertilization of agricultural land. After properly done seasonal agricultural work, Eter hopes to get a larger and better quality harvest, which will be sold for a good price. This will increase her income. The increased income will be used to repair the house, because the existing one is old and uncomfortable. Taking into account the above-mentioned, Eter will be able to spend the winter in a warm house and won’t be afraid of snow and rain.

loans.use: to cultivate and fertilize her agricultural land.

loans.name: Ildephonse

texts.en:
Ildephonse is married with one child of three years. He has been a maize farmer for 8 years. His wife is also a maize farmer. He would like to get this loan to buy more seeds, practice seed multiplication and support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he wants to renovate the house and make more savings.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more seeds, practice seed multiplication and support labor costs.

loans.name: Mtsoma

texts.en:
Mtsoma, 31, stands out as a very responsible and hardworking husband who looks after the well-being of his family, which consists of his wife and one son who is still an infant. They are his main reason for working harder every day. They all live together in their own house. Mtsoma has a kiosk in his home, selling consumer goods.

He is seeking a loan so that he can invest in his business. He hopes this will allow him to offer a better service and keep his customers very happy so that he can always count on them. With the loan, he plans to purchase bales of maize flour, sugar and sweets. Mtsoma has a thatched house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

loans.use: to purchase bales of maize flour, sugar and sweets.

loans.name: Julia Beatriz

texts.es:
En el sector del Colegio Uruguay en la ciudad de Portoviejo conocido como La Ciudad De Los Reales Tamarindos, ciudad bella y hospitalaria, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Buenos Amigos.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Julia, tiene 60 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis  hijos todos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa pero independiente. Su esposo es no vidente y le ayuda a ella en su negocio.

Nuestra amiga es una mujer muy luchadora que siempre le ha gustado trabajar para salir adelante junto a su familia, ella hace mucho tiempo aprendió corte y confección y gracias a estos conocimientos ella puso en su casa un pequeño taller de costura el cual lo ha ido surtiendo de mercadería para vender a sus clientes, ella también vende ropa, bisutería entre otras cosas, negocio en el cual le ayuda su querido esposo, lleva más de 30 años con su negocio y es como ella ha podido ayudara a su marido  y sacar adelante a su familia.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa, bisutería, telas y otros materiales para confeccionar sus prendas. Este es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y espera seguir por mucho tiempo más en el mismo.

Su sueño es tener salud ante todo.
texts.en:
The members of the "Buenos Amigos" (Good Friends) communal bank meet every two weeks in the Colegio Uruguay sector of Portoviejo, a lovely and hospitable city known as the "City of the Royal Tamarinds."  

This is where we met Julia. She is 60, married, and has six children, all adults. Two of them still live in her house, but are independent. Her husband is blind and helps her in her business.

Our friend is a woman who is constantly striving, and who has always liked to work, so that she and her family can get ahead in life.

She learned dressmaking a long time ago, and thanks to this knowledge set up a small sewing workshop in her home. Here she has been gradually stocking up on merchandise to sell to her customers. She also sells clothing, costume jewelry and other items, a business in which her dear husband helps her. 

She has been in her business for more than 30 years, and it is how she has been able to help her husband and raise her family.

This loan is to buy clothing and costume jewelry, as well as fabric and other materials for making her clothing. This is her first loan as part of the communal bank, and she hopes to remain in it for a very long time.

Her dream, above all, is to have good health.

loans.use: To buy clothing, costume jewelry, fabric and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Herman

texts.en:
Herman is married with three children aged between 6 and 12. All of the children attend schools. His wife is also a maize farmer. He has been a maize farmer for 10 years. He would like to get this loan to buy more seeds, seed multiplication (production of seeds for sale or for future planting) and support labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, he wants to make savings.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for more seeds, seed multiplication and support labor costs.

loans.name: Lene

texts.en:
Lene is sixty-one years old and married. Her six children are grown, and none of them are attending school. All of her family lives in the northeastern part of Albania, across the beautiful Adriatic coastline. Lene has been in the livestock and poultry business for the past twenty years and the business has been doing well.  Thanks to her personable nature and service skills she has been able to establish a large clientele. People in the region speak very highly of her.

This is her third time requesting a loan, with the previous ones being paid off. The loan she is requesting now is a Kiva loan via the VFA institution.  She plans to use it to buy feed for the animals. Lene is very appreciative of all potential Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy animal and poultry feed.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is a 42-year-old single woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 13 years to 18 years. She describes herself to be determined and caring. She operates a retail store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 4 years and employs 1 staff member. Her business is located in a favorable business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenges to be insufficient funds for improving the business and the delay of payments from customers. 

She will use the Kes 5,800 loan to buy a solar lantern for using at her business premises. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will have diversified her business into rental house services.

loans.use: to buy a solar lantern to use in her business at night.

loans.name: Nzungu

texts.en:
Nzungu usually sells fruits and vegetables of different varieties, such as bananas, mangoes, tomatoes, etc. Fresh fruits and vegetables are very popular and in high demand because people prefer to eat them every day and consider them very healthy. Another source of income includes a contribution from his spouse and also sales from farm produce.

Now Nzungu would like to invest more capital in his business and purchase more fruits and vegetables, and also fertilizers for his small vegetable garden. For this purpose he applied for a loan of Ksh 20,000. He hopes that the loan will improve his family's life.

loans.use: to purchase fruits, vegetables and fertilizer.

loans.name: Inti Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “INTI” iniciará el ciclo primer en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Roxana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de ropa, venta de licores, venta de tarjetas, venta de ropa americana, venta de vitrinas, venta de muebles, vidriería de aluminio.

La señora Roxana, indica que hace cinco ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de las amigas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de carpintería desde hace varios años, mismo que aprendió de anteriores trabajos.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de madera) que comprará de las barracas de la Cuidad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto fijo de la Ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación de salud.
texts.en:
The A.C. "INTI" will begin the first cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of Focal Center of Collpani. It is comprised of 7 members and is directed by a steering committee of which Roxana is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal association lead are varied. Among them we have: Clothing sales, liquor sales, card sales, sales of American clothes, sales of cabinets, furniture sales, and aluminum glassware.

Roxana says that it has been five cycles of friends entering by invitation that brings together Pro Mujer. She currently has a carpentry business which started some years ago, when she learned from previous work.

The loan that she will now take out is to increase capital (to purchase wood), which she will buy from the stalls of the City of El Alto and after treating it she will sell it in her stall in the city of El Alto. Through this work she will generate resources in order to support her family, as she is married and has 4 children.

When she was asked what she like about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the health training.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Isidro Danilo

texts.es: Isidro Danilo de 57 años de edad del departamento de chinandega con 5 hijos, se dedica a la actividad de reparacion de calzado (zapatero) , esta solicitando para hacerle mejoras a a su casa de habitacion  como costruir la sala , con el financiamiento comprar material de construccion como:  zinc, arena, cemento, cal, clavos, alambre, entre otros, el brinda las gracias a leon 2000 y el proyecto kiva  por brindarle el apoyo que necesita para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Isidro Danilo is 57 years old and from the Chinandega department. He has five children and repairs shoes - is a shoemaker - for a living. 

He is requesting a loan in order to make improvements to his home, like building a living room. With this financing he will buy construction materials like zinc sheeting, sand, cement, lime, nails, and wire, among other things. He offers thanks to Fundación León 2000 and Kiva for extending the support he needs to improve the conditions of his life.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheeting, sand, cement, lime, nails, and wire, among other things.

loans.name: Deo-Gracias 3 Group

texts.en:
Solange, age 44, is married with 4 children, ages 8 to 22 years old. All 4 of her children are attending school. She is representing the Deo-Gracias 3 group. Solange owns and operates a bakery where she primarily bakes cakes. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She will use the loan to buy flour and sugar for her cake making. Her business strategy is to sell cakes to all the shops in her community. She has received 1 previous loan from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo. She repaid well on her first loan. She hopes to one day be able to start another small business, selling clothes in the market.

loans.use: to pay for flour and sugar.

loans.name: Odai

texts.en:
Odai, a 21-year-old single guy, has five brothers and sisters. Odai is a university student majoring in Managerial Information Systems. At the same time, he works to support himself.

Odai has applied for this loan to pay for his summer semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his summer semester fees.

loans.name: Tharcisse

texts.en:
Tharcisse is married with four children between 14 and 20 years old; all of the children attend school. Tharcisse has been a maize farmer for 8 years; his wife is also a maize farmer. Tharcisse would like a loan to buy more seeds and seed multiplication and to support his labor costs to get the best possible harvest. With the profits, he plans to buy a cow and renovate his house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more seeds and seed multiplication and support labor costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase pesticides.

loans.name: Sylvestre

texts.en:
Sylvestre is married with four children between 1 and 14 years; three of the children attend schools. He has been a maize farmer for 10 years; his wife is also a maize farmer. He needs a loan to buy more seeds and seed multiplication and to pay for support-labor to get the best harvest possible. With the profits, he plans to pay for his children's school fees.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more seeds and seed multiplication and help pay for support-labor costs.

loans.name: Odette

texts.en:
Odette is married and has four children. She has been a maize farmer for 15 years. Her husband works as a businessman. Odette has applied for a loan to buy more seeds and seed multiplication and to help pay for support labor in order to get the best possible harvest. She plans to use the profits to buy cows for rearing.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more seeds and seed multiplication and to help with support-labor costs.

loans.name: Reynas Del Sur Group

texts.es:
EL GRUPO REYNAS DEL SUR ES UN GRUPO, SOLIDARIO CREDITUYO GUADALUPE. ESTA INTEGRADO POR 6 MUJERES SUS NOMBRES SON:
ANABEL,ERIKA,JOSEFINA,LILIANA, MARIA DE LOURDES Y NORA. ELLAS SON AMIGAS Y VECINAS DESDE HACE MAS DE 10 AÑOS, SE ENTIENDEN MUY BIEN ENTRE ELLAS, PORQUE TODAS SON COMERCIANTES Y TODAS QUIEREN SALIR ADELANTE EN SU NEGOCIO.ES POR ESO QUE DECIDIERON FORMAR ESTE GRUPO, PARA SOLICITAR CREDITO Y PODER INVERTIR EN SUS NEGOCIOS.
NORA ES UNA DE LA INTEGRANTES,TIENE 32 AÑOS DE EDAD ES MADRE DE 4 HIJOS DE 17,15,5 Y 3 AÑOS, ELLA VIVE EN UNION LIBRE CON SU PAREJA. 
NORA PIENSA UTILIZAR SU CREDITO,EN SURTIR MAS MERCANCIA ROPA DE TEMPORADA, COSMETICOS Y BISUTERIA.
NORA A FUTURO, LE GUSTARIA TENER UNA BOUTIQUE GRANDE CON VENTA DE ROPA PARA DAMA Y ACCSESORIOS, YA QUE EN ESTE MOMENTO ELLA VENDE EN LOS MERCADOS RODANTES. ELLA QUIERE LLEGAR A SER UNA GRAN EMPRESARIA PARA QUE SUS HIJOS TENGAN UNA VIDA FELIZ SIN PRIVACIONES DE NINGUN TIPO.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Reynas del Sur" is a group that is working with Credituyo in Guadalupe.  The group has 6 members who are all women, and their names are: Anabel, Erika, Josefina, Liliana, Maria de Lourdes, and Nora.  They have been friends and neighbors for more than 10 years, and they understand each other very well because they are all merchants who want to make progress with their respective businesses.  The reason that they formed this group is so that they could request loans that would enable them to invest in their businesses.

Nora is one of the members.  She is 32 years old, and is the mother of 4 children aged 17, 15, 5 and 3.  She is in a common-law marriage with her partner.

Nora plans to use this loan to stock up with merchandise, including seasonal clothing, cosmetics and accessories.  In the future, Nora would like to have a big store where she could sell women's clothing and accessories, because right now she is selling in the traveling markets.  She wants to become a great businesswoman so that her children will have a happy life without any kind of hardship.

loans.use: to stock up with merchandise to increase her inventory of clothing.

loans.name: Ana Suheildy

texts.es: Ana Suheidy del municipo de chinandega, tiene por actividad ecomomica el negocio de meracaderia en general, y caramanchel,( venta de cosmeticos, y productos de pulperia) desde hace 5 años el cual lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitacion , esta emprendedora inicio dicha actividad por la necesidad de tener una herramienta de trabajo para ayudar con los gastos de sus hijos, en la actualidad ha demostrado que es una persona responsable, trabajadora,  con ganas de superacion, con solvencia de pagos, Ana ya ha tenido creditos con fundacion leon 2000 lo cual le ha servido para hacer crecer el mismo dando buena atencion  a sus clientos con los productos que distribuye, Ana esta solicitando el fianciamiento para invertir en la compra de cosmeticos como: rubor, lapiz labial, base, lapiz de ojos, cremas antiarrugas, sombras, corrector,  rimel, entre otros.
texts.en:
Ana Suheidy from the municipality of Chinandega has a store where for 5 years she has sold general merchandise, including cosmetics and groceries. It is located in her residence. This enterprising woman began her store due to the necessity to have a means of supporting her children. 

She has now demonstrated that she is a responsable hard-working person who wishes to get ahead and meet her obligations. Ana has already had loans through Fundacion Leon 2000, which has helped her satisfy customers with products she sells. Ana is requesting financing to purchase cosmetics such as blush, lip pencils, base, eye pencils, antiwrinkle creams, eye shadow, correcting make up, and mascara, among other items to sell.

loans.use: buy blush, lip pencils, base, eye pencils, antiwrinkle cream, eye shadow, correcting make up, and mascara, among other items to sell.

loans.name: Thelma Olimpia

texts.es: Thelma continúa con su negocio de video juego, negocio pequeño pero rentable, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien labora como conductor, y su hijo que administra el negocio. Thelma necesita mejorar su techo, ya que es de Nicalit por sus años, se ha quebrado, y con las fuertes lluvias se le pasa el agua, lo que cambiara techo con este nuevo préstamo comprando: laminas de zinc, cuartones de madera, clavo para hacer el cambio y mejorar esta condición y bienestar para su familia.
texts.en: Thelma continues her video game business, a small but profitable business. She has the support of her husband who works as a driver and that of her son who manages the business. Thelma needs to improve her roof as it's made of Nicalit. Due to its age it has broken and when there are heavy rains, water passes through it. With this new loan she will change her roof, buying zinc sheets, wooden beams, and nails to make the change and improve its condition and the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheets, beams, and nails to repair the roof.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is 33 years old. She is married and lives in the Vale district with her family: husband, Zaza; three children (5, 11 and 12 years old) and mother-in-law, who is a pensioner. The older children go to the local [school]. Nana and her husband run an agricultural business. In particular, they have three milk cows and a calf. They produce dairy food: cheese, curds and yogurt, and sell them at the local open market. The family owns 0.75 hectares of land as well, where they grow potatos and cabbage. Nana and Zaza work hard during the spring and summer seasons to get a good harvest. Along with their agricultural business, they are also busy with trading. Seasonally, they sell vegetables and fruits using their own Ford Transit car in nearby villages. The total average monthly income of the family is 1000 lari.

Nana requested a loan for cultivation of the agricultural land and to purchase additional agricultural products to sell. After properly doing the seasonal work, she hopes to get a good harvest. Nana and Zaza will sell their harvested products together with other agricultural products in the nearby villages. They hope to get their planned income. With increased income, they will be able to spend more on the family’s daily needs. As a result, the family’s living conditions will improve.

loans.use: to water agricultural land and purchase agricultural products for selling

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 73 años de edad , soltera , sin hijos del municipio de chinandega, esta emprendedora es una persona, capaz, luchadora, ,que todavia a su edad , lucha dia a dia por tener mejores condiciones de vida,  Carmen tiene por actividad economica la venta de productos varios   el tiempo de tener el negocio 41 años el la actualidad a pesar de las dificultades propias como el tiempo, problemas ecomonicos, la edad ha superado las pruebas , gracias al apoyo que  leon 2000 junto al programa kiva le ha brindado para sacar adelante su negocio, invirtiendo en productos el cual ofreces a su clientelas. Los productos que ofrece son: pocicles,  golosinas, galletas, gelatinas, sopas maruchan.
texts.en: Carmen, who is 73 years old, is single and has no children. She comes from the town of Chinandega. This entrepreneur is a capable, hard-working person, who still, at her age, works day after day to have better living conditions. Carmen's business is the sale of a variety of products. She has had this business for 41 years. Now, in spite of her difficulties, such as the weather, economic problems, and her age, she has overcome these trials, thanks to the support that Leon 2000 together with the Kiva program have offered her so that she can advance her business by investing in the products that she offers her customers. The products that she offers are popsicles, candies, cookies, jellies, and Maruchan soups.

loans.use: to buy popsicles, candies, cookies, jellies, and Maruchan soups to sell

loans.name: Juana De La Concepcion

texts.es: Juana, de 62 años de edad, soltera con dos hijos, esta emprendedora siempre se ha caracterizado por ser trabajadora, responsable, con animo de superacion, ya que ha demostrado que con su esfuerzo pudo sacar adelante a sus hijos a pesar de los problemas de salud de uno de ellos ya que hasta la fecha la envia a la escuela especial , ha sido  la razon por la cual la motiva dia a dia a levantarse temprano para seguir luchando por ellos,  Juana  tiene por actividad economica la una pulperia ubicada  en su casa de habitacion, tiene  de experiencia en el negocio 22 años, el financiamiento lo quiere para comprar productos de consumo diario para el hogar como:  leche, pan, arroz, azucar, cosmeticos, ropa, queso, frijoles, verduras, tiste entre otros
texts.en:
Juana, 62 years old, is single with two children. She is an enterprising woman who has always been characterized as being hard-working, responsible, and motivated to succeed. She has demonstrated that with effort, she was able to move her children forward despite one's health problems who is currently going to a special school. This is the reason she is motivated to get up early every day to continue fighting for them.

Juana works at a small store located in her home and has 22 years experience in this business. She would like this loan to buy everyday consumer products such as milk, bread, sugar, cosmetics, clothes, cheese, beans, vegetables, tiste (a traditional drink), and other items.

loans.use: to buy milk, bread, rice, sugar, cosmetics, clothes, cheese, beans, vegetables, tiste (a traditional drink), and other items

loans.name: Dossou

texts.fr: Dossou est un homme marié de 36 ans. Père de 2 enfants âgés de 2 et 5 ans dont 01 scolarisé, il gagne sa vie en exerçant comme commerçant dans l’achat et la revente d’appareil de sonorisation. Servant une catégorie très variée de clientèle, il rêve d’avoir une boutique et de pouvoir employer des jeunes aspirants à son domaine d’activité. Il effectue ses opérations financières depuis cette année avec WAGES et sollicite un crédit en vue de s’approvisionner en appareils de sonorisation variés.  Il espère prendre son envol avec ce crédit et participer activement à l’épanouissement de ses enfants. Il est dans cette activité il y a 05ans.
texts.en: Dosou is a 36-year old married man. He has two children, two and five years of age, one of whom is in school. He earns a living as a vendor, buying and reselling audio electronics.  Serving a very wide public, he dreams of having a store and being able to employ young trainees. Since this year, he manages his financial transaction with WAGES. He is seeking a loan in order to stock up on audio electronics. He hopes for his business to take off so that he would be able to  ensure his children's well-being. He has been in this business for five years.

loans.use: to buy audio electronics.

loans.name: Martha Elena

texts.es: Martha Elena de 50 años de edad del municipio de chinanadega, con tres hijos, este emprendedor tiene por actividad economica la venta de productos varios como (gaseosas, hot dog, granos, golosinas, entre otros.) la actividad que la inicio desde hace 10 años para la ayudar con los gastos del hogar, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitacion. En la actulidad ha salido ha delante con el apoyo que fundacion leon 2000 le ha brindado y con el programa kiva ya que le ha permitido invertir y suertir su pequeño negocio el cual le genera ganacia para el sustento de su familia.
texts.en: Martha Elena, who is 50 years old, is from the town of Chinandega. She has three children. This entrepreneur's business is selling a variety of products such as soft drinks, hot dogs, grains, candies, and other items. She began this business 10 years ago to help with the household expenses. The business is located in her home. Now she has moved forward with the help that the Foundation Leon 2000, together with the Kiva program, has offered her, since it has allowed her to invest and stock her little business, which generates earnings for the support of her family.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, hot dogs, grains, candies, and other items to sell

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en:
Immaculee is married and has three children. Her husband works as a cobbler. She has been a maize farmer for 7 years. She wants this loan to buy more seeds, for seed multiplication [production of seeds for sale or for future planting] and to pay for labor costs to get the best harvest. She wants to use the profits for renovating her house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy and harvest seeds and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Claudia Cristina

texts.es:
Claudia es una mujer de 37 años, se encuentra felizmente casada, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con su esposo y sus 3 hijos, ella es una persona muy alegre, entusiasta y trabajadora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos para que junto con su esposo puedan sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para solventar sus gastos y apoyar a sus padres, por ello no pudo terminar de cursar sus estudios primarios, pero Claudia sueña con poder hacerlo algún día; en sus ratos libres le gusta ver televisión en compañía de sus hijos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Seco de Res para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia y gracias al apoyo de su familia, desde hace varios años Claudia puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de anticuchos, ella realiza su labor de manera ambulatoria, desde tempranas horas de la mañana empieza a elaborar los diversos platos para que en las noches cuando inicie sus ventas todo esté listo y sus clientes puedan degustar los riquísimos anticuchos, tripitas, pancita, bofe, entre otros; Claudia se siente a gusto en su trabaja y cree que su negocio marcha bien debido  a que sus cliente la recomiendan por su excelente sazón y buena atención.
Claudia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la construcción de su vivienda hecha de adobes, ya que actualmente su casita está hecha de esteras; de esta manera Claudia podrá contar con una vivienda en mejores condiciones, brindando seguridad y bienestar para su familia, y así en un futuro no muy lejano espera poder tener un restaurant propio para seguir creciendo y saliendo con su familia.
texts.en:
Claudia is a 37-year-old woman who is happily married and lives in the city of Nazca with her husband and their three children. She is a very happy, enthusiastic, and hardworking person who devotes all her effort, along with that of her husband, to getting their family ahead. Regrettably, from a very young age she had to work to settle her expenses and support her parents. For this reason she couldn't complete her elementary school studies. Still, Claudia dreams about being able to do this one day. In her free time she likes to watch TV with her children and on occasion she cooks the delicious dish, Seco de Res (Cilantro Beef Stew), to share with her family.

By her own initiative and thanks to the support of her family, Claudia began her small business selling kebabs several years ago. She performs her work as a street vendor. From the early morning hours she begins to prepare the diverse dishes so that when she begins her sales in the evenings, everything is ready and her customers can taste her delicious kebabs, intestines, tripe, and cow lungs, among other items. Claudia feels happy with her work and believes that her business is going well due to her customers recommending her for her food's excellent flavor and her good service.

Claudia is very thankful along with Kiva borrowers since thanks to the help given she will be able to carry out the construction of her home made of adobe. Currently her small home is made of mats. In this way Claudia will be able to have a home that's in better condition, giving safety and comfort to her family. In the not-too-distant future she hopes to be able to have her own restaurant to continue growing and going out with her family.

loans.use: to build her home.

loans.name: Inés

texts.es:
Doña Inés, comerciante, dueña de su propio negocio es una pulpería, con 19 años de experiencia, su negocio consiste en vender produtos de alimento y uso personal tales como de arroz americano y nacional, azúcar, aceite, frijoles, nevax, golosinas, purina, pollo, cerdo, entre otros. Se ubica a orilla de la carretera que queda cerca de su casa, y les vende a las personas que viajan y pasan diariamente por esa zona, tambien sus mismo vecinos que viven en el sector, ella no deja de vender y tiene una ventaja que no tiene competencia por eso es que siempre le va bien en su negocio. Reside en el departamento de Masaya, su núcleo familiar es de 3 ella y sus dos hijos. 

Necesita invertirle a la pulpería y  se acerca a nuestra oficinas Ceprodel para solicitar un nuevo financiamiento en el que pueda suministrarle mas a su negocio y que le ayude con la demanda que es muy fuerte. Gracias a los créditos que ha obtenido por parte de Ceprodel a engrandecido mas su negocio y mejorado su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ines, a merchant, has owned a small grocery store for 19 years. Her business consists of selling food and personal products like imported and local rice, sugar, oil, beans, toilet paper, pet food, chicken, beef and other things. The store is located on the edge of the highway close to her home and she sells to people who travel through this area and pass by daily, as well as to her neighbors. She never stops selling and doesn't have any competition, which is why her business is going well. She lives in the state of Masaya. Her family is comprised of herself and her two children.

She needs to invest in the store and came to the Ceprodel offices to ask for a new loan to stock her store better and meet her high demend. Thanks to the loans from Ceprodel she has grown her business and improved her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy imported and local rice, sugar, oil, beans, toilet paper, snacks, pet food, chicken, pork, etc.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a single mother of three children ages 10 to 18 years. She describes herself as a determined woman. 

Irene operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruits such as bananas, avocados, watermelon and pineapple. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a viable area and her primary customers are local residents. Irene describes her biggest business challenge to be the fruit spoiling, especially during the cold season when fewer customers buy. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years.

Irene plans to use the KES5,800 loan to buy a solar lantern for use as a light in her house in order to reduce the cost of paraffin.

loans.use: to buy a solar lantern for her home.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge  Alberto  de 57 años de edad, casado  tiene por actividad ecomomica la venta de productos lacteos, tiene 8 años de experiencia en el negocio, el cual lo distribuye de forma ambulante,  actividad ecomomica que inicio  con un poco de ingresos propio como obrero  y lo aprendio de la esposa , hoy en dia ha  crecido en demanda ya que tiene mucha cliente y ofrece varidad y calidad de productos, el fiananciamiento lo quiere para invertir en productos lacteos como: leche, queso, cuajada la cual la vende  pro libra. En la actualidad da gracias a leon 2000 y programa kiva por la ayuda que le brindan con los financiamiento para poder trabajar y sacar adelante a su familia y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Jorge Alberto is 57 years old, married, and sells dairy products for work. He has eight years of experience in the business, and distributes as a street vendor. He began this work with his small income as a worker and learned it from his wife. Today his demand has increased as he has many customers and offers a variety of quality products. He wants the funding to invest in dairy products like milk, cheese, and curd, which he sells by the pound. At present he is thankful for Leon 2000 and the Kiva program for the help they are giving him with the funding in order to be able to work, get his family ahead, and improve their lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy dairy products like milk, cheese, and curd.

loans.name: Juan Jesus

texts.es: El señor Juan  es  una persona  responsable  y  muy  trabajadora, a lo largo de sus créditos se  ha  distinguido por  tener  una excelente  cultura  de pagos   es por ello que  nuevamente  se  acerca  a la institución para  que  lo apoyemos  en  el proyecto  de  remodelación de vivienda  ,  el desea    terminar la  construcción del portal de  su  casa, ve  en  el crédito la posibilidad  de  que su  hogar  tenga  una mejor  imagen por  lo que  se  encuentra  muy  contento ya  que  este  es  el patrimonio de   sus  hijos.
texts.en: Juan is responsible and hardworking. Through the course of his loans he has distinguished himself by having an excellent payment ethic, which is why he came again to the institution for support in remodeling his home. He wants to finish constructing an entryway for his house. He sees in this loan the possibility of his home having a better image, which would make him happy because it is his children's inheritance.

loans.use: to construct an entry way for his home.

loans.name: Ineza

texts.en:
Ineza is from Badiauri village of Sagarejo District. She is 30 years old, married and lives with her family: husband – Gocha and parents-in-law, who are pensioners. Gocha is a chief cook and gets a salary every month. Her mother-in-law also works, at the village school. Ineza and her father in-law are busy with agricultural activities. They have two milking cows and produce cheese. Part of the cheese is used by the family and the rest is sold locally. The family also owns a vineyard. They work hard during spring and summer seasons to get a good harvest. They pick grapes in autumn, part of which is used for production of wine. They sell the rest of grapes and the wine they have produced in nearby villages. Total average monthly income of the family is 1000 Lari.

Ineza requested a loan for purchasing piglets. She will raise them and sell them in winter. Grown pigs will be sold for a good price. By doing this, she will be able to expand her agricultural business and increase the income of the family accordingly. With the increased income she will be able to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to raise and sell.

loans.name: Maia

texts.en:
Maia is 34 years old; she lives in a small village of Sagarejo District with her family: husband – Mamuka and her brother-in-law. Mamuka is a construction worker and gets service fees for work. He also helps Maia and his brother in the family agricultural business. In particular, they have 3 milk cows and produce cheese. The cheese trader buys most of their cheese. Along with their small dairy farm they are busy with a plot. They own 1 hectare of land, where wheat is grown. Total average monthly income of the family is 1000 Lari.

Maia requested a loan for purchasing wheat. With more wheat she will be able to feed more cattle. This will increase the sales from her business and positively affect the income of the family. With the increased income she will be able to reinvest in the family agricultural business to expand it and make more profitable. As a result of the above mentioned activities the living conditions of the family will be improved.

loans.use: to purchase wheat to feed the cattle.

loans.name: Ridvan

texts.en:
Ridvan is a 44-year-old married man with six children, all girls, ranging in age from four to fifteen years old. The family lives in a village in the southeastern part of the country. 

For the past six years, Ridvan has been running a dairy and animal sale business that has proved to be profitable, and the growth in clientele has been proving that there is high demand for what he offers.

Redvan has requested a Kiva loan via VisionFund Albania in order to purchase more cows to help his business grow. This is his third loan with the previous ones being successfully paid off. 

With any profits he makes from the growth of his business, he will be able to raise and educate his children and re-invest in his business. This loan will be a tremendous help to him and his family and they are all very grateful to Kiva potential lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cows.

loans.name: Redgernold

texts.en:
Redgernold lives in Malindi, Kenya. He is married and has two children – one is in school. He is a farmer and began farming two years ago. Besides farming, Redgernold is also employed as a teacher at a private primary school.

Redgernold learnt of Milango from his friends and he is now applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenyan shillings to pay for pesticides and fertilizers. The only challenge he faces is the seasonal weather. Redgernold’s future ambition is to be able to farm an acreage of about ten acres. He will save his extra income to pay for his children’s school fees.

loans.use: to pay for pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Neli

texts.en:
Neli is 47 years old. She is married and lives in a small village in Sagarejo District with her family: husband – Guram and their 27 year-old son. The family earns their living through agricultural activities. They have 2 milk cows and a calf. They produce dairy food: cheese, curds and yogurt and sell them on the local open market. 

Along with agricultural activities, Neli and her son are agricultural workers. They help neighbor farmers and get service fees for their work. They work hard but their income is hardly enough for food and everyday expenses for the three-member family. The total average monthly income of the family is 700 Lari.

Neli requested a loan for purchasing an additional milk cow. This will help her expand her dairy farm. Neli will be able to produce more dairy food and since there is a great demand for her products at the market, she will sell them for a good price. This will increase the family income accordingly and she will be able to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Sarah is selling coconuts and green bananas in her local community. She has had this business for six years. Aside from that, she also has a sari-sari (variety) store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. 

She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos to buy stock of coconut and green bananas to resell.

Sarah has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Sarah hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stock of coconuts and green bananas to resell.

loans.name: Irfan

texts.en:
Irfan is in his fifties, married and has two children, twenty-six and twenty-four years old. He and his family live in a little town in the south of Albania. For the past five years, he has been carrying out a bar-café business. 

Irfan's business has been doing fine and he wants to grow it now by offering more items and services.  For this, he needs to buy more inventory. The money he has at the moment is almost nothing and cannot be used for this purpose because he has been the only one to financially support his family of five.

Irfan is applying for a Kiva loan now through VisionFund Albania to stock up on inventory items.  This will be his third loan, with the previous ones being repaid.  The previous loans have not been Kiva loans and he very much wants to thank in advance all lenders at Kiva for their great support in this matter.

loans.use: stock his cafe/bar

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is a married mother of three school-going children. She lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She owns a salon which has been in operation for the last six years. She started it off from her savings and an investment from her parents. This is her only source of income.

Rukia has seen the business grow and when she heard of Milango from her friends, she decided to join in order to access credit. Her challenge has been the lack of adequate equipment, an issue she believes can be sorted by this loan.

Rukia is asking for a loan of 41,850 Kenyan shillings to purchase a dryer, mirrors, chairs and cosmetics for her business. She will use the extra income from this loan will help improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: buy a dryer, mirrors, chairs and cosmetics

loans.name: Zakaria

texts.en:
Zakaria is a resident of Changamwe, Kenya. He runs a retail shop which has been in operation for six months. His business is located in the area normally visited by truck drivers linking the two Kenyan cities. He is married. Zakaria received the startup capital for his shop from his savings and mainly sells cereals.

Zakaria joined Milango upon introduction by his friends and is applying for a loan of 31,450 Kenyan shillings to purchase additional stock of cereals. The only challenge in the business has been the high cost of retail stock and price fluctuations, but Zakaria believes this will be sorted since the harvesting season just began. Zakaria believes the business will grow and he will soon have a chain of businesses and increase his profits.

loans.use: buy cereals to sell

loans.name: La Lumiere 2 Group

texts.en:
Yannick, aged 38, is a single mother with a 15-year-old child. She also provides for her father. Yannick is representing the La Lumiere 2 group. She owns a small restaurant. She has been operating this business for over 15 years. She will use the loan to buy chicken, fish, oil, and charcoal. Her business strategy is to offer good customer service. She is friendly and welcoming to all of her customers. 

Yannick has received 1 previous loan from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo. She has a good repayment record. She dreams of opening a shop and traveling abroad.  She hopes her daughter will be able to study abroad after she graduates from high school. She will provide what she can to help her daughter.

loans.use: buy food and charcoal for her restaurant

loans.name: Elida

texts.en:
Elida is 37 years old and is living with her husband and 2 sons. Her house is equipped only with running water. It is located in Nueva Arica, in the province of Chiclayo in Northern Peru. She is a hard-working woman determined to progress and improve her living conditions and that of her family. As a result, she has a strategic mind.  This is now the second loan she is taking with Edpyme Alternativa with the support of Kiva, given that the first one was successfully and punctually repaid.

The primary business activities in the region are agriculture, farming, and tourism. Elida raises and sells livestock, mainly poultry, turkeys, ducks, and guinea pigs. The corrals where the livestock are kept are located in the rear section of her property. She feeds them a balanced diet and natural plants (alfalfa). When the livestock have reached an optimum size and weight she sells them at the different markets in the city of Chiclayo. 

After her first loan helped her to consolidate her business, Elida is now requesting a loan of 1500 nuevos soles to make updates to her house and improve the quality of the condition where her family lives. She has proven a very responsible person.

loans.use: improve her house

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
Sokha, aged 52, is a married father living in a rural area of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Cambodia. He has eight children, four of whom are still in his care. Sokha has been rice farming on one-hectare of farmland for twenty five years.  He also supplements his family’s income by fishing. He can earn around KHR43,300 per day to support his family. The main challenge for his business is lack of water for his rice farming. 

Sokha’s group consists of two members. He has been with VisionFund for one cycle and has successfully paid back the past loan. The other member has been with VisionFund for two cycles. In order to support his family for a better living, Sokha is leading his group to apply for a loan with VisionFund.
