As the leader, he is going to use his portion of KHR 1,200,000 to buy fertilizers for his farmland and a water pump and use a portion of it to fix his boat. He hopes this loan will enable him to increase his family's income and also improve their standard of living.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and a water pump

loans.name: Bienvenida

texts.en:
Bienvenida is a resident of Talibon, Bohol. She is 47 years old and has a business selling home-cooked snacks. For 22 years now, she sells pancake and rice cake in the neighborhood. Bienvenida would like to increase her production and is asking for a loan to buy flour, sugar and cooking oil.

Bienvenida has five children. Her eldest is 24 years old and her youngest is 16 years old. Once her business is doing good, Bienvenida will be able to provide her family with the basic necessities like a healthy diet and pay for household bills.

loans.use: buy flour, sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Ra's Group

texts.en:
Ra, 33, is a married father of one son who is still in his care.  They are living in a village in the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Cambodia. He has been a rice farmer and fisherman for eighteen years. To earn extra income, his wife has been planting watermelons and beans to support the family. They can earn around KHR 73,900 per day from their current businesses.

This is Ra’s first loan with VisionFund, while his group member has been with VisionFund for two cycles already. As the group leader, Ra is leading this group to apply for a loan with VisionFund of KHR 1,000,000 each. He will use his portion to buy fertilizers and an aspirating pipe for using with a water pump. He hopes this loan will enable his family to make more income to make their living better.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and a pipe

loans.name: Sinang's Group

texts.en:
Sinang is twenty-seven years old and lives in the Ek Phnom district of Cambodia. She has three children, two daughters and one son, one of whom is a dependent working in the family's business. 

To make a living, Sinang has been planting rice and watermelons for ten years, while her husband is fisherman. Sinang earns approximately KHR 60,000 per day from her current business and spends KHR 44,700 to support her family. The main challenge for her is lack of water for her rice field.

This is Sinang’s first group loan. Her group consists of two female members. She is leading her group to apply for a loan of KHR 1,000,000 each. As the group leader, Sinang is going to use her portion to buy a boat for her family's business. She hopes to make more income to support her family and make their living better.

loans.use: buy a fishing boat

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Susan is selling fish in her local community. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos to buy more fish to resell, like milk fish, sardines and flying fish.

Susan has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Susan hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to resell.

loans.name: Thorn's Group

texts.en:
Thorn is aged 29. She is married and blessed with three children, two daughters and one son. She lives in a rural village of the Mongkul Borey district in Cambodia. To earn a living, she has been involved in rice farming and grocery selling for 10 years. She supplements her family’s income by working as a paid worker. Thorn is able to earn around KHR10,000 per day from her current business. The main challenge for her is low crop yields from crops that have been destroyed by floods.

Thorn has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles, while her fellow group member has been with VisionFund for four cycles. She has used the past loans successfully to make her family's living conditions better. Now she is leading her group of two to apply for a loan with VisionFund of KHR 1,200,000 each. As the group leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and grocery items for resale. With this loan, she hopes to get more income from her business for supporting the family for a better life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and grocery items.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a 60-year-old married woman with three grown-up children. The oldest child is 30 years old. Rosalina's husband works as a farmer.

Rosalina tills their rice field in San Jose, Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. Rosalina has been growing rice for six years. This business provides them the income that they need.

This loan will be used to purchase rice seedlings and fertilizers and pay  for the maintenance of the equipment used in the field, such as tractors and others. In the coming days, Rosalina hopes to further improve their yield by applying methods that could enhance the productivity of their farm, thus giving them a higher income. Any additional income she adds will be saved for future needs.

loans.use: to buy rice seedlings and fertilizer and pay for maintenance for the equipment (a tractor and other items).

loans.name: Phoeurt's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Mongkul Borey of Banteay Meanchey province, Phoeurt is married with four children, three of whom (two daughters and one son) are working as paid workers in Thailand. She has been in the pig raising business for fifteen years while her husband is a paid worker in a local area. With the family's current business, she is able to earn about KHR 20,000 per day to support her family.

Phoeurt's group consists of three members. She and another member have been with VisionFund for five cycles while the other has been with VisionFund for four cycles. She completely paid back the past loans, which have helped her make a better living. Now leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund, Phoeurt, who is the leader, is going to use her portion to buy 2 more piglets and pig feed. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family's income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy pigs and pig feed

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Kokovi

texts.fr: Kokovi  est une femme veuve âgée de 41 ans avec 1 enfant de 14 ans qui est scolarisé. Elle prend de sa progéniture et d’elle-même en effectuant le commerce du charbon de bois. Confrontée à un problème de liquidité, il lui est difficile de pouvoir disposer à tout moment de stock suffisant pour pouvoir couvrir la demande. Elle fait confiance à WAGES et y épargne ses revenus. Elle sollicite un crédit dans le but de s’approvisionner en stock de marchandises. Elle espère que ce crédit lui permettra d’améliorer ses rendements et enfin de prendre soin de sa progéniture.
texts.en:
Kokovi is a 41-year-old widow with a 14-year-old child, who is in school. She supports her offspring and herself through commerce in charcoal. Confronted with a liquidity problem, it is difficult for her to have a sufficient inventory at all times, so as to meet the demand. 

She trusts the microfinance institution WAGES and saves her revenues there. She is requesting a loan with the goal of stocking up  on products. She hopes that this loan will enable her to improve her returns and finally to take care of her child.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child.
 
Tessie is selling snacks in her local community, like "suman" and "biko" (rice-based desserts). She has had this business for seven years. She requested a loan for 4,000 Philippines pesos to buy raw ingredients for making these snacks, like sugar, cheese, flour and margarine.

Tessie has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future,Tessie hopes to improve her business for the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Noussi Eugénie

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de deux enfants qui vont tous à l'école, Noussi Eugénie a une boutique où elle vend des mèches, des tissages et des gels depuis quelques années. Elle se ravitaille à l'extérieur du Bénin. Face à la forte demande de ses clients qui augmente sans cesse grâce au bon emplacement du fonds de commerce, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit auprès de Finadev en vue de de combler les attentes de ses clients et de maximiser son profit. Le surplus généré lui permettra de participer à la scolarisation des enfants et d'épargner. Elle ambitionne ouvrir un grand salon de coiffure et de mèche.
texts.en:
Married and a mother of two children, who both go to school, Noussi Eugénie has a store where she has been selling hair extensions, weaves, and gels for a few years. She stocks up from outside Benin. 

In face of the strong demand from her customer base, which is ever-growing thanks to the right use of capital, she requested and obtained a micro-loan from Finadev with the aim of fulfilling the expectations of her customers and to maximize her profit. 

The surplus generated will enable her to help cover her children's school costs and to save money. Her ambition is to open a large salon for hairstyling and hair extensions.

loans.use: to buy 2 packets of hair extensions, 3 packets of weaves, 2 containers of gel, and a 100-gram container of hair product

loans.name: Hing's Group

texts.en:
Hing is 38 years old. She lives in a rural village of the Mongkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province, Cambodia. She has four children, three of whom (two daughters and one son) are still dependent on her. To earn a living, she has worked as a rice farmer on 2 hectares of farmland for 15 years. She earns approximately KHR19,000 per day to spend on family's basic needs.

Hing has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles and completely repaid the past loans; her fellow group member has been with VisionFund for one cycle. The past loans have helped her to make a better living. As the group leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yields so as to earn more income to set aside some money to afford to buy a hand tractor for her rice farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Sinat's Group

texts.en:
Sinat is 40 years old and is living in a rural village in the Mongkul Borey district in Cambodia. She has three children, one daughter and two sons. Sinat is a rice farmer, and her husband is a sculptor. She has been in this business for ten years, earning approximately KHR30,000 per day. She spends KHR15,000 to meet her family’s need. 

Sinat has received four loans and successfully paid back the past loans with VisionFund while the other member of her group has been with VisionFund for two cycles. After receiving the loans from VisionFund, she is confident that she will be able to make her living better. She is leading her group of two to apply for a loan with VisionFund of KHR1,000,000 each. As the group leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and a portion of it to buy more sculptured items for her husband's business. She hopes to make more income from her current business so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and more sculptured items

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Kai's Group

texts.en:
Kai, aged 31, lives in a rural area of the Sangke district of Battambang province, Cambodia. He and his wife have no children yet. Kai has been planting rice for five years. To better support the family, his wife sells grocery items such as seasonings, soap, eggs, etc. to earn extra income. With the current business, his family can earn approximately KHR 66,700 per day to support their living costs. The main challenge of their business is low crop yields as a result of floods. 

Kai has been with VisionFund for one cycle and has successfully paid back the previous loan while the other member of his group has been with VisionFund for two cycles. The previous loan helped Kai with a better living standard. Now he is leading the group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. 

As the leader, Kai is going to use his portion to buy fertilizers for rice farming and will use some to buy grocery items to sell. He hopes this loan will enable his family to earn more income to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for rice farming and grocery items to sell

loans.name: Khenh

texts.en:
Khenh is requesting a new loan to buy a greater range and quantity of products to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. 

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to stock her general store with a greater range and quantity of products.

loans.name: Uudus

texts.en:
Uudus, aged 43 , lives with her husband and her three sons in a small old house she owns in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her younger son is a secondary school student. Her husband and two sons help with her business. She has been running her meat retail business in the local market for five years. Uudus already has many regular customers and suppliers. Her business is sustainable.

In the last few years, her old house has been very cold due to the heating loss through walls and windows. Therefore, Uudus has started to build her new house. The money she has saved is not enough for the new house. The loan that she is requesting will be used to build her new house with headers (beam-like supports) and vacuum (insulated) windows. Uudus is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to finish the house.

loans.use: To build her new house with headers and vacuum windows

loans.name: An

texts.en: An is requesting a new loan to buy materials to increase her production of candles. An's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy materials to increase her production of candles.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 40-year-old Hawa in a rural area in Freetown. She is widowed with five children between the ages of 8 and 19 years. Her children are currently attending school. 

Hawa  runs a local goods store at the market square. She sells local goods like beans, cornflower, native rice and vegetable oil. She has been running this business for seven years. She began this business because when she lost her husband, she had no one to take care of her children's schooling.   She works at the business every day except holidays. Her other source of income comes from small-scale farming. At present she is faced with the problem of transportation. 

Hawa has requested a loan in order to buy more foodstuffs such as palm oil, bags of native rice, beans and dried peppers. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children. She thanks you for your support!

video.title: Kiva Borrower Test from Sierra Leone

loans.use: To buy local foodstuffs such as palm oil, bags of native rice, beans and dried peppers.

loans.name: Abu

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Abu.  He is married but has no child.  In 2009, Abu established his business selling jeans, bags, shoes, etc. He began his business because he lost his father who was paying his school fees, so he left school and decided to go into business so that he will be able to take care of himself and his family.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

Abu would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. He requires this loan in order to buy more clothes so that he can realize more profits. In the future, Abu plans to get a better business and start selling wholesale.  He hopes to live a better life with his family.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more clothes so that he can realize more profits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stock to satisfy her customers' desire.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
This is 29-year-old Alex.  He is married and has 1 child, aged 4 years.  In 2007, Alex established his business selling mobile phones, DVDs and MP3. He began his business because he wants to support his family. Working 7 days a week and 9 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

Alex would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000 in order to buy different types of mobile phones. In the future, Alex plans to become a leading mobile supplier in town. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones to sell

loans.name: Nasser

texts.en:
Nasser is 28 years old and lives in the town of Luwero in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past three years, Nasser has been working hard to manage his small business which sells phone accessories. 

To help expand his business, Nasser has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more phone accessories for resale and will help Nasser to generate greater profits, and pay school fees for his children. Nasser hopes that in the future he will be able to build more rental houses. 

Nasser is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Nasser who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more phone accessories for resale.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala South region of Uganda. He is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past eight years, Isaac has been working hard to manage his stone quarry where he sells all types of stones. 

To help expand his business, Isaac has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more materials like a hammer that will be used for stone quarrying, and will help Isaac to generate greater profits and further expand his business by adding more other different hardware materials. Isaac hopes that in the future he will be able to own a hardware shop. 

Isaac is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Isaac who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more materials like a hammer that will be used for stone quarrying,

loans.name: Suzan

texts.en:
Suzan is 29 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school.  Suzan has been working hard to manage her small business, selling charcoal at retail and wholesale. 

To help expand her business, Suzan has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more charcoal for resale, and will help Suzan to generate greater profits and to expand her business by adding more sacks of charcoal. Suzan hopes that in the future she will be able to supply charcoal in the whole  town. 

Suzan is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Suzan who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for resale

loans.name: Efuransi

texts.en:
Efuransi is 36 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is widowed and has four children, three of whom are currently in school. For the past 12 years, Efuransi has been working hard to manage her clinic where she sells herbal medicine. 

To help expand her business, Efuransi has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more herbal medicine for resale, and will help Efuransi to generate greater profits and to increase the quality of services. Efuransi hopes that in the future she will be able to be self-reliant. 

Efuransi is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Efuransi who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more herbal medicine for resale

loans.name: Penina

texts.en:
Penina is 30 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past 7 years, Penina has been working hard to manage her small business that sells timber. 

To help expand her business, Penina has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more timber for resale, and will help Penina to generate greater profits and to increase her capital stock. Penina hopes that in the future, she will be able to grow her business to another branch. 

Penina is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Penina who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase more timber for resale,

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 26 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is single and has 3 children with 2 currently in school. For the past 5 years, Sylvia has been working hard to manage her shop, which sells charcoal at retail and wholesale. 

To help expand her business, Sylvia has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more charcoal for resale. and will help Sylvia to generate greater profits and increase her capital stock. Sylvia hopes that in the future she will be able to start up a retail shop. 

Sylvia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sylvia who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 46 years old and lives in the town of Kasagati in the Kampala East region of Uganda. She is married and has 6 children with two of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Juliet has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells household items like sugar. 

To help expand her business, Juliet has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like sugar and salt for resale, and will help Juliet to generate greater profits and increase her capital stock. Juliet hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business size. 

Juliet is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Juliet who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like sugar and salt for resale

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 32 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala West region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, two of whom currently attend school. For the past five years, John has been working hard to manage his small business which sells timber. 

To help expand his business, John has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more timber for resale, and will help John to generate greater profits and increase his capital stock. John hopes that in the future he will be able to start up another branch. 

John is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like John who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more timber for resale

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 35 years old and is married with five children, three of whom currently attend school. She lives in the town of Kasangati in the Kampala East region of Uganda. For the past three years, Beatrice has been working hard to manage her retail shop which sells essential commodities like sugar and soap. 

Beatrice is requesting a 2,000,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to buy more essential commodities like sugar and soap for resale. Her loan will help her to generate greater profits and pay for necessities for her family. Beatrice hopes that in the future she will be able to build a residential house. 

Beatrice is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). This program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Beatrice who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like sugar and soap for resale.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is 30 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala West region of Uganda. He is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past three years, Musa has been working hard to manage his business where he makes bricks. 

To help expand his business, Musa has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy fire wood for burning the bricks and also pay the workers, and will help Musa to generate greater profits and increase his income. Musa hopes that in the future he will be able to improve his capital inflow and start up another business. 

Musa is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Musa who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy fire wood for burning the bricks and also pay the workers

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is 44 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is widowed and has two children who are currently in school. For the past three years, Dorothy has been working hard to manage her retail shop, where she sells cosmetics. 

Dorothy is requesting a 2,000,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to buy more cosmetics and new brands. Her loan will help her generate greater profits and expand her inventory. Dorothy hopes that in the future she will be able to build rental houses. 

Dorothy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Dorothy who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy new brands of cosmetics

loans.name: Americo

texts.pt:
CASADO e PAI de  4 filhos todos maiores de idade, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É agricultor, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (areia, cimento, portas, janelas, e PAGAMENTO DE CONTRACTO DE ENERGIA) para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa.
No futuro deseja concluir a sua casa e construir murro de vedação, para tal compromete-se a pagar o empréstimo devidamente para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é o elevado custo e cuidar dos filhos.
texts.en:
Americo is single and the father of four children, all of them adults. He lives in a house he owns and doesn't support anyone else.
He's a farmer. With the current loan he intends to purchase construction supplies (sand, cement, doors, window frames), and also to pay his electricity bills, in order to continue building his house.
In the future he wishes to finish building his home and an enclosing wall. For that reason he pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so he can request more from Hluvuku.
His challenge is high expenses and caring for his children.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (sand, cement, doors, window frames, etc.) in order to continue building his house.

loans.name: Sambalhundev

texts.en:
Sambalhundev is 49 years old and lives with his wife and his two children in an apartment that he owns in Darhan city, Mongolia. His two children are secondary school students. His wife is unemployed. 

Sambalhundev has been running a public transport business for the past 10 years. He wants to expand his business as his business income is not sufficient to provide for his family. Therefore, Sambalhundev is planning to run his transport business between Ulaanbaatar and Darhan. 

Also, his wife is planning to work in a document copying service at a rented workplace. The loan that he is requesting will be used to buy a copy machine and notepaper for his wife's new business. Sambalhundev is a diligent and honest man. He is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT.

loans.use: To buy a copy machine and notepaper for his wife's new business

loans.name: Jumdah

texts.en:
Jumdah is 36 years old and is married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. Jumdah has been running a general store in the Philippines for the past 14 years and also earns an income from raising chickens and cows and selling "copra" (dried coconut meat).

Jumdah has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She is now requesting a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell. Jumdah aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Liezl

texts.en:
Liezl is 42 years old and is married with four children. With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them. Liezl has been running a general store in the Philippines for the past 15 years. She sells a variety of items such as canned goods, cream, bread, biscuits, etc. 

Liezl has requested a PHP 18,500 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase items to sell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a resident farmer in Nkubu, Central Kenya, where she produces milk, tea and vegetables. She has been in farming for thirty years with the help of one farmhand. She is married and has six adult children.

Agnes has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds. She says this will improve her farming income and make her independent and have better standards of living. She also plans to buy more land to expand her farming business.

Agnes says Juhudi Kilimo staff are doing a commendable job.

loans.use: buy poultry birds

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years. Lorena earns additional income from a general store.

Lorena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell in her business. Lorena dreams of building and expanding her business to secure her family's future and to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Carmel

texts.en:
Carmel is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a welding shop business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 12 years. Carmel earns additional income from hog raising.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. Carmel is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy tools and equipment for her welding shop business. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for her welding shop.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years. Lourdes earns additional income from raising pigs.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. Lourdes is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant business. She dreams of repairing and renovating her family home in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Henerieta

texts.en:
Henerieta is 47 years old and from Nakuru. She is married and has four children who are aged between 23 and 13 years old.

Henerieta has a grocery business and a clothing business that she has been doing for the past twelve years and has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy more clothes to sell.

She hopes to have a permanent place for operating her business,build a permanent house for her family and see to it that her businesses do well.

loans.use: to buy clothes to add to her stock.

loans.name: Marko Ekama

texts.en:
Marko operates a transport business commonly known as boda boda, and his wife sells charcoal. He ventured into this business three years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 10,300. 

Having repaid his previous loans, Marko is now requesting a third one for KES 55,000 to top up the amount he has already saved to purchase a motorbike. His profit will help him pay school fees for his children. 

His dream is to see his business grow and earn him enough money to meet his family's needs.

loans.use: to  purchase a new motorbike.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Fourty-year-old Rose is married to Luke and blessed with five children aged 20, 16, 13, 10 and two years respectively. She sells fish, a business she started 17 years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

She has requested her first loan of KES. 30,000 to purchase more fish for sale. The profit earned from the business will help her venture into another line of business. Her dream is to become a great businesswoman in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more fish for sale.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 40 years old. He is married to Mary and together they have six children. He is a farmer and has been in the business for the past 12 years.  He gets a monthly income of KES 10,000 from his business.

This is his third loan from KADET LTD.He paid his previous loans well and in good time. He was introduced to KADET LTD by Credit officer. He will use the loan amount to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for planting.

He hopes to rent more farming land.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Tsuma

texts.en:
Tsuma is 35 year old bookshop proprietor in Mariakani. He is a married  with five school going children. His business has been in operation for the past nine years and it is doing great.
 
This is his third business loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to purchase textbooks, exercise books, and geometrical sets for sale. He will use the anticipated profits to plough back into the business. 

He hopes to have a bigger, more profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase textbooks, exercise books, and geometrical sets.

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en:
Mathew is 38 years old father of two children aged eight and five years old and he is married to Lucy. He is a farmer in Nyahururu town where he plants cash crops such as maize, beans and potatoes and he has been in the business for the past two years.

This being his first loan from KADET LTD, he plans to use the loan amount to buy chickens and start poultry farming. This will enable him to supply eggs and chickens to various hotels and thereby make more income with which he plans to pay school fees for his children.

In the future, Mathew hopes to invest more in his farming business, make more income and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy chickens for poultry business.

loans.name: Festus

texts.en:
Festus is  31 year old tailor in Mikindani, Mombasa. He is a married father of two children. He has been sewing clothes for his customers for the past eight years with great success.  

This is Festus’ fourth loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to purchase a new sewing machine, sewing thread, and cloth materials. He will use the anticipated profits to buy a piece of land to build business premises. 

He hopes to have a prosperous life.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine, sewing thread, and cloth materials for his tailoring business.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 26 years old and is married to Eva.  They have one child, who is one year old.

Samuel has a transportation business in which he transports wholesale goods to various retail shops. He has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to buy more goods in bulk, like soaps, soft drinks, and cooking oil for supply to the retail shops.

He hopes to buy a piece of land and build a house for his family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more goods in bulk, like soaps, soft drinks, and cooking oil, for supply to retail shops.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Marilyn works hard to support her family. She has a food and fruit vending business in the Philippines. 

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her business. Marilyn hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell in her stall

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Marivic works hard to support her family. She has a meat retail business in the Philippines and earns additional income from selling frozen foods.  Marivic is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional meat to sell in her business.

Marivic has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional meat to sell

loans.name: Mary Suzzete

texts.en:
Mary Suzzete is 37 years old and is married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. Mary Suzzete has been running a general store in the Philippines for the past 15 years and earns additional income from raising livestock.

Mary Suzzete has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She is now requesting a PHP 10,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional items for her general store. Mary Suzzete aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional items for her general store

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Merlita works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from buying and selling fish and mineral water. Merlita is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for maintenance for her motorcycle transport business.

Merlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is a businessman living in Likoni town, Kenya. He carries out farming as a source of income. Mohamed began the business twenty years ago and besides this, he also sells fruit juice.

Mohamed learned of Milango from him friends. He was introduced to Milango this year and is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenyan shillings to purchase more coconuts to sell. The coconuts are used in many meals in the coastal area. His aspiration is to supply to other major towns in the country. He believes that the additional income he earns as a result of this loan will enable him to provide for the basic needs of his family and to purchase additional stock. His main challenge has been theft and some customers not paying on time.

loans.use: To purchase more coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam, who lives in the Changamwe, Kenya, is a water vendor. She is married. She supplies water to her neighborhoods. This idea came from the fact that water delivery in the area is a challenge. She began the business three years ago and also sells doughnuts.

A loan of KSH 83,450 will help Mariam purchase more stock to make doughnuts. Apart from the high cost of living and the reduced disposable income of many customers of such businesses, Mariam has been facing the challenge of a lack of storage tanks -- a problem she sees solved by the purchasing of these water tanks. She also intends to apply for a water meter and sell water from a tap instead of pushing a handcart.

loans.use: to buy stock for making doughnuts.

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is a resident of Kongowea, Kenya. She is a married mother of six children; five of whom are in school. 

Linet owns a nursery/preschool, which has been in operation for a year. She walked from house to house inviting students to join her school. Most of these students could not afford fees. The school has been in operation for one term (three months but has a very promising future and the enrollments keep increasing).

Linet learnt of Milango from the Company employees and decided to join in order to access credit. Linet is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to purchase chairs, writing boards, chalk and books. She aspires to increase the number of streams in future despite the initial low enrollment and will use the extra income to start other businesses.

loans.use: to purchase chairs, writing boards, chalk, and books.

loans.name: Douglas

texts.en:
Douglas is a resident of Kongowea, Kenya. He has three children and runs a motor cycle transport business in the area. This mode of transport is preferred by many who lack enough money for transport and also for movement within short distances in the area. He began the business two years ago and he is also employed elsewhere.

Douglas was introduced to Milango by his friends and is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to repair his motor cycle. He will save the additional income obtained from this loan. The challenge with the current business is theft of bicycles and lack of customers at certain times of the day.

loans.use: to repair his motor cycle.

loans.name: Malila Group

texts.en:
Catherine, who is in her early late 20s, is married with two children who are still going to school.  She has had a salon business since 2006.  She works from 7.00 am to 10 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to restock the missing items in the salon, paid school fees, household expenses and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She wants a loan to buy more salon equipments and a generator for her beauty salon. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

Catherine, will share this loan with her loan group "Malila" with 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more salon equipments and a generator for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Willison

texts.en:
Willison lives in Mariakani, Kenya. He owns a cafe which has been in existence for twenty five years and employs two other people. He is married and has six children. He started the business from his personal savings and assistance from friends. 
A loan of 104,750 Kenya shillings will help him purchase more chairs and tables for his cafe and thereby also open another cafe. The challenge facing the business is high cost of materials and the overall inflation. 
Willison states that the additional income from this business will help him purchase a pick up track to supply meet the daily family requirements and also improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more chairs and tables for his cafe.

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe is 45 years old and is married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them. Phoebe has been running a general store in the Philippines for the past 15 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, biscuits, eggs, noodles, canned goods, etc.

She is requesting a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock for her general store. In the future, Phoebe would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her general store

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is married and works hard to support her family. She has had a fruit vending business in the Philippines for the past 15 years. 

Rowena has requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fruits for her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional fruits for her business

loans.name: Mwanashabani

texts.en:
Mwanashabani is 26 and has been married for more than six years. She and her husband have two children, all of whom are in school. Mwanashabani operates a tailoring business in Likoni, a small town in the city of Mombasa. She has operated this business for four years. She started her business, because she studied tailoring and dress-making before she started working. She greatly enjoys tending to her clients, so she decided to open her own tailoring shop. She is now requesting a loan for the purchase of clothing materials and thread. These are the items that she uses the most in her tailoring.

Mwanashabani and her husband, Salim, are very grateful to the microfinance institution, because if things keep going as they have been, the quality of everything in the tailoring shop will increase. This makes them very happy, because their children will not have to go without education in the future. Currently, they live in their own house that has piped water but no electricity, though they hope to have this amenity very soon. She faces a major challenge of market competition.

loans.use: to purchase clothing materials and thread.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is single with two children who are adults and independent. For the past ten years she has worked as a tailor. She also sells coconuts at the market on the side.

Mwanamisi started working for others as a tailor while still very young. During that time she saved up some capital and was able to start her own business. She is a very hardworking person who very much wants to get ahead. 

Mwanamisi is asking for a 20,000 KES loan from Yehu to buy cloth and coconuts so as to have a good supply of stock available to offer her customers. She thanks Yehu and Kiva for the opportunity to take out a loan because it will be of great help to her.

loans.use: to buy cloth and coconuts.

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is a single woman and has no child. She has a well-stocked restaurant business that is in a good location and helps her make the daily income she needs.

Mishi says she began selling household products, but then changed to her current business, which is going very well. On the other hand. she also operates a cyber cafe where she earns her other source of income. She is a hard-working entrepreneur who makes every effort to earn income.

She is requesting a loan to buy meat, beverages, flour, chicken, and other items to have enough inventory on hand to continue making the food she sells.

loans.use: to buy meat, beverages, flour, chicken, and other items for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Terezia

texts.en:
Terezia, who is married and lives with her husband in Samburu, the city of Mombasa, is a shopkeeper. She owns a grocery store, which is very well known in the neighborhood. She started her business from her own savings and then, thanks to her work and sacrifice, her grocery store grew and her business is now self-sufficient, using only the profits it returns. Terezia defines herself as a very hard-working person and someone who is very keen to get ahead and to better herself.

Terezia is asking for this loan to stock her store with baked goods, noodles, fizzy drinks, rice and other supplies, which are the products that generate the biggest profits. With these products, she will be able to meet demand as well as improve her income.

loans.use: to stock her store with baked goods, noodles, fizzy drinks, and rice.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 43 years old and is married with five children. She earns a living with a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Sarah has been in the pig fattening business for eight years and earns additional income from selling rice.

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and additional pigs to raise. Sarah is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase feed and additional pigs to raise

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 16 years. Carolina earns additional income from selling food.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. Carolina is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell in her business. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase ten sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Bibi

texts.en:
With her previous Kiva loan, Bibi bought sacks of mangoes and coconuts that she sold, increasing her working capital slightly. Now she is applying for a new Kiva loan, because she wants to expand to a vegetable stall business, and Bibi's working capital is insufficient to start up another business.

This is the reason why she is requesting a Kiva loan  to buy fruits and vegetables from the harvest, at a good price and above all very fresh. Bibi tells the lenders that her Kiva loans have been very useful to her. She says thank you, and may they continue helping her.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to start a vegetable stall business.

loans.name: Ntenga

texts.en:
Ntenga is a married woman who is 40 years old, with three boys and three girls. She is a devoted woman who is determined to ensure that her children have quality education. Two girls are in class seven and four; while two boys are in class four and two.

She has been selling mats and baskets for over eight years, selling them at the nearby market. Ntenga is married to an industrious husband who is a farmer and she helps her husband in catering for the basic needs of the family. They dwell in their own house thatched with palm fronds and which lacks electricity and piped water.

Despite her hard work, she faces a challenge of high transport cost and also lack of enough capital to expand her business. She is therefore applying for a loan amounting to Ksh 30,000 to purchase more mats and baskets for sale. She thanks Kiva and Yehu for their support, hoping that it will boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more mats and baskets for sale.

loans.name: Nassoro

texts.en:
Nasoro is an industrious man who sells natural medicines in his neighborhood. He is taking out another loan to expand his existing business.

Thanks to his business, which has been running for more than 10 years, he can educate his children. He has a dream of seeing that the children who are in school reach University.

Nasoro is applying a second loan of KSH 12,745 to purchase more stock of natural medicines to sell.

Thanks to Yehu and Kiva for the opportunity given to him.

loans.use: to purchase more natural medicines to sell

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 28 years old and lives with his common-law wife.  The couple does not yet have any children.

Isaac is a member of Yehu microfinance, located in the coastal region of Kenya.  He lives with his beautiful wife in a rental house that has both electricity and piped water.  

Isaac is a shoemaker and designer, and he sells to the general public. He is requesting another loan to buy leather and some decorations. With the help of this loan, he will be able to expand his business. Thanks to his previous loan, he was able to save money and start this current business.

Isaac’s dream is to open a shoe shop in future. In his free time he enjoys spending time with his friends.

loans.use: to buy leather and some decorations.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is 29 years old with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. Eliza has run a general store in the Philippines for the past 10 years and also earns an income from selling rice.

Eliza has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She is now requesting a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock for her general store. Eliza aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional stock for her general store

loans.name: Marivel

texts.en:
Marivel is 39 years old and is married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. Marivel has run a general store in the Philippines for the past 16 years and also earns an income from selling Avon.

Marivel has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She is now requesting a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items for her general store. Marivel aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy items for her general store

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 18 years. Nancy earns additional income from selling food.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. Nancy is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her business. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a 35-year-old married woman living in Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She works hard to support her husband and their six children aged 15, 12, 9, 7, 3 and a seven-month-old baby. 

Gemma has been in a fishing business for five years with her husband. She is asking for a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy school supplies for her children, like notebooks, and to buy materials for the renovation of their house, like wood, cement, nails, etc. 

In the future, Gemma hopes to increase her husband's fishing catch so that she has something to sell at the market. She is positive that the loan will be a great help for their children's education which is her foremost concern and for the renovation of their house.

loans.use: to buy school supplies and to buy materials for house renovation

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a café owner living in the Coastal town of Changamwe, Kenya. She is single and has two school-going children. Pamela started the business from her personal savings. The area has a high number of residents due to the low cost housing and this makes such a business quite a profitable venture. She employs two other people. Her business has been running for five years and has faced the challenges of price fluctuations and the high cost of materials.

Pamela would like to maximize her income. She was introduced to Milango by an employee and is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenyan shillings to purchase additional stock such as sugar, beans, cooking oil and charcoal. Her ambition is to make her café a world class shop in the near future. She believes the additional income from this loan will help to improve her family’s living standard and to provide her children an education.

loans.use: buy stock for her cafe

loans.name: Hoi

texts.en: Hoi is requesting a new loan to buy materials for producing artificial flowers. Hoi's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy materials to make artificial flowers to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en: Hanh is requesting a new loan to buy materials to increase her production of clothes. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will help her to expand her business, earn more income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy materials to increase her production of clothes.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Ablavi 50 ans, est mariée sans enfants. Elle est revendeuse de produits divers et est l’épouse d’un commerçant. Elle achète sur commande de la volaille, du charbon de bois, du maïs, du haricot etc… Opérant avec WAGES depuis plusieurs années, elle sollicite ce onzième crédit dans le but d’étendre son activité. Elle pense donc s’approvisionner en marchandises nécessaires à son commerce. Elle compte reverser les profits générés par son commerce sur son compte sous forme d’épargne. Elle espère devenir grossiste et fonder une famille financièrement stable.
texts.en:
Ablavi is 50 years old and married, with no children. She sells various products and her husband is a shopkeeper. She places orders for poultry, charcoal, corn, beans, etc...

She has been working with WAGES for several years now, and she is seeking her eleventh loan to help expand her business. She plans to use the loan to stock up on essential goods for her business.

She plans to put the profits generated by her business into her savings account. She hopes to someday become a wholesaler and to start a financially stable family.

loans.use: to buy poultry, corn, and other various items

loans.name: Bao

texts.en: Bao is requesting a new loan to buy a range of products, such as beverages and coffee, to restock his shop. This purchase will help him to better meet the needs of his customers. His previous loan enabled him to improve his business and offer his customers a greater variety of products. He hopes that his new loan will assist him in increasing the size of his store and increase sales, and will also help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy beverages and coffee in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Hoang

texts.en: Hoang is requesting a new loan to expand her business by buying more gas tanks from different suppliers to satisfy her customers. Hoang's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more gas tanks from different suppliers for resale.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es: La señora Ana es una humilde habitante de León, de 47 años de edad, madre de dos hijos, ella clienta Kiva de oficio comerciante se  dedica a la venta de tortillas desde los 26 años  de edad. Ana dice que su primer préstamo fue de gran ayuda porque pudo invertir en su negocio además de las ganancias que obtuvo logro mejorar  las condiciones del local, utilizo el crédito para comprar maíz y leña para hacer tortillas, pero ella quiere diversificarse aun mas en productos para su negocio ya que la demanda es mucha  es por esta razón que hoy requiere del crédito al igual para comprar maíz y leña para su negocio pues los productos van subiendo de precios  y necesita estar preparada para la temporada de lluvia, ella estima que esta nueva inversión será de ayuda porque podrá  comprar la materia prima necesaria para el negocio, podrá satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, Ana dice que su siguiente paso es comprar zinc y maíz para ir guardando para las temporadas difíciles, ella espera contar con el apoyo de Kiva para mantener su trabajo ya que es algo que le gusta hacer y con lo que ha podido salir adelante.
texts.en: Ana is a humble woman who lives in León. She is 47 years old and has two children. She is a Kiva client who, as a trader, has been selling tortillas since she was 26 years old.  Ana says that her first loan was a great help as she was able to invest in her business. In addition to the profit that she made, she succeeded in improving the conditions of her business premises. She used the loan to buy corn and firewood to make tortillas. However, she would like to diversify further in products offered by her business, as demand is high. That is why she now needs a loan, like the previous one, to buy corn and firewood for her business, because products are going up in price and she needs to be prepared for the rainy season. She considers that this new investment will help because she can buy the raw materials required for the business, and she will be able to meet the needs of her customers. Ana says that her next step is to buy zinc and corn to put aside for use during difficult times. She hopes to have the support of Kiva to allow her to continue with her work, since it is something that she loves doing and that has enabled her to get on in life.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Campeonas Group

texts.es:
GRUPO CAMPEONAS ES UN GRUPO SOLIDARIO DE CREDITUYO, ESTA INTEGRADO POR 7 MUJERES. TODAS SON VECINAS LA MAYORIA DE ELLAS,SE DEDICA AL COMERCIO.TODAS ELLAS TIENE SUEÑOS DE LLEGAR A TENER UN NEGOCIO BIEN ESTABLECIDO YA QUE LA MAYORIA DE ELLAS SON DE BAJOS RECURSOS,CASI NINGUNA TUVO ESTUDIOS,POR ESO SE DEDICAN AL COMERCIO 
COMO VENTA DE COMIDAS,ROPA Y CALZADO.
BERTHA ES UNA DE LAS INTEGRANTES TIENE 52 AÑOS, ES MADRE DE 5 HIJOS DE 37,34,28,23 Y 24 AÑOS TODOS YA CASADOS.
ELLA UTILIZARA SU CREDITO PARA SURTIR CALZADO DE TEMPORADA.
EL SUEÑO DE BERTHA ES LLEGAR A TENER UNA ZAPATERIA EN EL CENTRO DE LA CIUDAD. YA QUE ELLA VENDE EN SU CASA, Y ESTA MUY COMPLICADO PARA LOS CLIENTES, PORQUE  ELLA VIVE EN EL CERRO Y NO SUBEN LOS AUTOMOVILES Y HAY QUE LLAGAR CAMINANDO. Y EN TIEMPOS DE LLUVIA SE COMPLICA MAS.
A BERTHA LE GUSTARIA QUE SUS HIJOS TRABAJEN CON ELLA Y DESPUES HEREDARLES EL NEGOCIO A SUS HIJOS Y NIETOS.
texts.en:
The Campeonas ("Champions") group, affiliated with Credituyo, consists of seven women.  All are neighbors, and most of them are traders.  They all dream of having a well-established business, but they all have few resources, and practically none of them have any education.  This is why they work selling food, clothing, and shoes.

Bertha is one of the group's members.  She is 52 and has five children, who are 37,34,28,23 and 24.  All her children are married. She will use her loan to buy seasonal footwear.

Bertha's dream is to be able to have a shoe store in the center of her city.  At the moment, she sells from home, and it is very complicated for her clients because she lives on a hill, and since automobiles cannot climb it, her clients have to walk up.  When it rains, it is even worse.

Bertha would like her children to work with her and for her children and grandchildren to inherit the business.

loans.use: to stock seasonal footwear.

loans.name: Yadira

texts.es: Doña Yadira, reside en el departamento de Masaya, es comerciante desde hace 8 años, su negocio consiste en un taller de zapatería en  el que junto con su esposo se encargan de echar a andar el negocio, cuenta con tres trabajadores que laboran en el taller ubicado en su casa de habitación, entre los que se mencionan el calzado que elaboran es zapatos de vestir para niñas y  para damas. Doña Yadira mujer emprendedora ya que no solo maneja el taller de calzado sino que también  es costurera de ropa artesanal y  también tiene ese medio de trabajo el cual lo desempeña con mucho orgullo, comenta que no le gusta estar en un solo punto sino que le gusta innovar, para ofrecer a sus clientes un producto de excelente calidad. Se presenta nuevamente a nuestra oficina Ceprodel y solicitar un financiamiento que le permita suministrar de materia prima sus negocio y poder cumplir con la demanda que siente a engrandecido. Considera que sus ventas han incrementado y mejorado sus ingresos, de tal manera que le esta permitiendo dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Señora Yadira lives in the department of Masaya. She has worked as a storekeeper for the last eight years. Her business consists of a footwear workshop, set up and run by her and her husband. She has three employees working in the footwear workshop, which is located in her home. Among others, they make dress shoes for girls and ladies. Señora Yadira is an enterprising woman who not only runs the footwear workshop, but also works as a seamstress of handmade clothing and is very proud of this work. She says that she does not like to limit herself to just one thing, but likes to be innovative, to offer her customers a product of excellent quality. Once again, she has applied to our CEPRODEL office for a loan that would allow her to purchase raw materials for her business and meet the demand that she feels is on the increase. She believes that her sales and income have increased, thus enabling her to provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy soles for girls' shoes, white and yellow glue, linings, trimming and fabrics.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: José es una persona trabajadora y muy  responsable la cual se esfuerza  día  con día  por  sacar  adelante  a su   familia, el se  dedica  a la  elaboración y  venta  de   pan   dulce  la  cual   realiza  por las  calles  de la  localidad   además  de  surtir  de su  producto  a  las  tiendas  de abarrotes, el a  lo largo de sus  créditos  se  ha   distinguido por  tener una excelente  cultura  de  pagos, se acerco   nuevamente  a la  institución ya  que  requiere  realizar  la compra  de  materia  prima para   seguir  elaborando  el  pan, agradece  el  apoyo  brindado  para la  realización de sus proyecto  ya que  ve  en  el crédito la posibilidad  de  hacer  crecer  su   negocio.
texts.en: José is a hardworking and very responsible person, who battles every day so his family can get ahead.  He makes pastry, which he sells in the streets of his neighborhood, as well as supplying his product to grocery stores.  He has an excellent payment history for his previous loans.  He now needs a loan to buy raw materials to make his pastry.  He is grateful for the opportunity that this loan gives him to realize his projects and to allow his business to grow.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make pastry.

loans.name: Roger Francisco

texts.es:
Roger tiene la edad de 21 años, soltero, reside en el departamento de Masaya, cuenta que a raíz de que su mamá tubo que viajar a otro país para poder mantenerlos a el y su hermana,  decidió emprender su propio negocio, su mamá le facilito el capital para poder iniciar,  es una pulpería y la  tiene ubicada en su casa de habitación, gracias a esa iniciativa a salido adelante con su hermana,  es un joven trabajador que desde pequeño a tenido que trabajar para ayudar a su familia. Actualmente mira que en su negocio ha ido aumentando la demanda por lo que necesita invertirle más.
Se acerca a nuestras oficinas Ceprodel para adquirir un préstamo que le permita reabastecer  en productos su negocio. El cual piensa que le servirá de mucha ayuda para incrementar sus ventas y de igual manera expandir más su negocio.
texts.en:
Roger is 21 and single.  He lives in the department of Masaya. Because his mother had to travel to another country in order to support him and his sister, he decided to open his own business.  His mother gave him the start-up capital.  He has a grocery story located in his house.  Thanks to his initiative, he and his sister are getting ahead.  He is a young man who has had to work since a very young age to help his family.  

He now needs to invest more in his business because demand has increased.  He has approached Kiva partner Ceprodel to seek a loan to restock the products in his shop.  This financing will allow him to increase his sales and thus to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy sweets, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, toilet paper, wood, costume jewelery, lingerie, and perfume.

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es: La Sra. María Victoria de 57 años de edad se dedica a la costura y venta de zapatos, ella es divorciada y vive sola pero ha mantenido la fuerza para salir adelante, el deseo de superación y sus hijos son lo que la siguen manteniendo fuerte día a día. Sus hijos son casados y viven fuera de la ciudad pero siguen apoyando a su mama de diversas maneras.  Recientemente María  cambio de domicilio y esto ha generado que las maquinas de coser que tiene se maltraten, en esta ocasión ella pide de nuestra ayuda para dar mantenimiento a las maquinas que tiene y comprar nuevas ya que su negocio está en crecimiento.
texts.en: Señora María Victoria is 57 years old. She works as a seamstress and she also sells shoes. She is divorced and lives alone, but has had the strength to move on in life. Her children and her desire to overcome her difficulties are what maintain her strength from day to day. Her children are married and live out of town, but they still support their mom in various ways. María moved house recently and her sewing machines were handled roughly during the move. She is therefore asking for our help with the maintenance of these machines and with the purchase of new machines, as her business is growing.

loans.use: to maintain her own sewing machines and buy new ones.

loans.name: Thi

texts.en: Thi is requesting a new loan to buy and process waste materials for recycling and sale to wholesalers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business, processing capacity and sales. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business and increase her income, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy and process waste materials for recycling

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La señora Virginia  de 45 años de edad, es madre de 7 hijos tres de ellos fallecidos y cuatro están ya independizados, Doña Virginia se dedica desde hace 2 años a la venta de ropa nueva y radica en la comunidad de el Tular Nacaome, Valle.
El préstamo que Doña Virginia esta solicitando es de 10,000.00 lempiras, lo necesita para comprar ropa interior y ropa americana (Fardos Usados), con las ganancias de este préstamo ella pretende seguir aumentando su capital de trabajo y seguir mejorando su condición de vida.
Con apoyo del préstamo desea  lograr su objetivo que es surtir Su negocio y realizar sus sueños de mejorar su casa.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2012
texts.en:
Virginia is 45 years old. She is the mother of 7 children. Three of them pased away and four of them are grown. Virginia  has sold new clothes for 2 years and lives in the community of Tular Nacaome, Valle.

The loan that Virginia is asking for is for 10,000.00 lempiras. She needs it to buy underwear and American clothing (used). With the earnings from this loan she intends on continuing to increase her working capital and improving her quality of life.

With the support of the loan she hopes to acieve her goal of stocking her business and making her dream of improving her home come true.  

San Lorenzo, Honduras - June, 2012

loans.use: to buy underwear and American clothes for her business.

loans.name: Hiep

texts.en:
Hiep is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock his general store. This purchase will help him to better meet the needs of his customers. His previous loan enabled him to improve his business and offer his customers a greater variety of products.
He hopes that his new loan will assist him in increasing the size of his store and increase sales, and will also help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as foods, beverages, detergents, soaps and shampoos to stock his general store

loans.name: Crosalita

texts.en:
Crosalita has been a farmer for 15 years now. She is from Talibon Bohol. She is married with two grown children. Together with her husband, she works in their rice field for this is their only source of livelihood. 

Right now, Crosalita is in need of additional capital to make her business successful. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, insecticide and pay the labor fees of the hired help. She is motivated to continue working on her farm so she will not have to depend on her grown children for her personal needs. Her profit from farming will be used for the family's daily consumption.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides and pay for labor fees

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai is 43 years old and is married. She lives with her husband in Ho Chi Minh City.

Mai and her husband earn an income to support their family by running a general store. They sell a lot of household items such as shampoo, plastic items and camp beds. Mai intends to use her loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of plastic products to sell from her store. 

Mai hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and variety of plastic products to sell from her store

loans.name: Wyne

texts.en:
Wyne is married with 4 children. She is 42 years old and lives in Canicapan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Wyne owns and operates a plot of farmland, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 8 years and earns 5,000 PHP each month. She requested a loan of 5,700 PHP to purchase farm chemicals. Wyne has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for a year. In the future, Wyne's plan is to save her returns in order to buy another plot of farmland.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals

loans.name: Fausta Karolina

texts.es:
La señora Fausta de 32 años de edad es madre de tres hijos y vive con su conyugue quien es comerciante, ellos alquilan en el lugar donde viven en la ciudad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, dedicándose al  negocio de venta de achinería que es su negocio desde que comenzó a dedicarse al comercio.
Doña Fausta el préstamo lo necesita para  la compra de mercadería para surtir el negocio como cosméticos, juguetes, adornos para navidad y  cosa de plásticos como bazos, platos y más.
Con el préstamo doña Fausta piensa mejorar su negocio.
El sueño de doña Fausta es tener un local propio donde vender sus productos y también desea construir su casa ya que donde vive es rentado.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2012.
texts.en:
Fausta is 32 years old. She is the mother of three children and lives with her spouse, who is a merchant. They rent the house they live in in the city of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras where they work selling knickknacks, which is what they have done since they began their business. 

Fausta needs the loan to buy merchandise to stock her business. She needs cosmetics, toys, Christmas decorations and plastic items such as cups, plates and more. With the loan, Fausta is planning on improving her business. 

Fausta's dream is to own her own locale where she can sell her products and also build a house, since she rents now.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - June, 2012.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, toys, Christmas decorations and plastic items such as cups and plates and more for her business

loans.name: Maria Salome

texts.es:
María sigue con su venta de fritanga comida en variedad, madre soltera que ha apoyado a su familia, estudios solo da a un hijo que esta con ella, los otros independiente, la demanda de su pequeño comedor aumento con los años al tener su clientela, es por tal razón con los financiamiento obtenidos en Afodenic, compra más productos en carnes para poder vender máss, onteniendo mejores resultados.
Con este nuevo préstamo comprara: carne de res, carne de cerdo, pollo, frutas y verduras, para dar más variedad de platillos, y lograr mejores ventas.
texts.en:
María continues selling fried food.  She is a single mother who has supported her family.  Only one of her children still lives with her and attends school.  The others live independently.  The demand she experiences at her small food stall has risen over the years.  She has used loans from Afodenic to buy more meat products so that she can sell more and obtain better results.

María will use this loan to buy beef, pork, chicken, fruit and vegetables so that she can offer a wider variety of dishes and achieve better sales.

loans.use: to buy beef, pork and chicken to increase her food sales

loans.name: Gs Tablones I Group

texts.es:
La Señora Enma es una persona muy emprendedora dedicada a su negocio, Ella vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. En Choluteca en el sur de Honduras. Y tiene más de 3 años de tener el negocio de venta de leña.
Enma el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de leña y mano de obra y de esta manera incrementar más sus ventas. Con el préstamo espera mejorar sus ventas y así atender mejor a sus clientes. Con estos fondos espera que su negocio sea más sólido y rentable.
Enma sus sueños es poder y darle a sus hijos una  mejor educación y ayudar a su familia.
Gerson se dedica a su negocio propio compra y venta de ganado  desde hace mas de 10 años en el mercado de esa zona.
Wilmer se dedica su negocio propio compra y venta de ganado. Desde hace mas de 6 años en varios caseríos de la zona.
Choluteca, Honduras - Junio del 2012
texts.en:
Enma is a very enterprising person who is dedicated to her business. She lives with her husband and her 3 children in Choluteca in southern  Honduras. She has had her business selling firewood for more than 3 years.

Enma will invest the loan in buying firewood and in paying for labor costs, thus increasing her sales. With the loan she hopes to improve her sales and thus serve her customers better. With these funds she hopes her business will more solid and profitable.

Enma dreams are to be able to give her children a better education and help her family.

Gerson has had his own business buying and selling cattle for more than 10 years in the area market.  
Wilmer has had his own business buying and selling cattle in various communities in the area.

Choluteca, Honduras - June, 2012

loans.use: to buy firewood and to pay for labor costs

loans.name: Lissette Anayeli
